For Rabobank, Global People is looking for a Junior Risk Professional!
Imagine...being able to secure banking for every customer of the Rabobank. As a Junior Risk professional you can deliver an important contribution to first line monitoring on various topics, like Business Continuity Management, Information Security, IT Risk, Identity Access Management and overall Risk awareness. In support of the Risk Manager and the risk owner you will help the to execute the standard periodical assessments to become and stay in control of their risks.
Making a difference  • Supporting First Line Monitoring for one or more departments.• Managing Cloud on boarding processes.
With each otherCollaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our First Line Monitoring Center (FLM Center) team brings talented people together to support and challenge the organisation on becoming and staying in control aligned with our mission ‘Driving secure banking together’. With you as a one of our Risk Professionals, the team will consist of diverse colleagues in a variety of roles, including:Risk Manager: “Together with the Risk Professional we provide the correct execution of our risk & control process.”IT Specialist : “Together with the Risk Professional we are able to automate the risk & control process in an effective way and making it as easy as possible. Supporting the risk owners to perform the risk assessments themselves as much as possible.”
With youCustomer focus, collaboration, deliver results mind set and persuasiveness are clearly essential for the role of Risk Professional. In addition, it's important that you recognise everything in the checklist below:• At least 1 year experience in Risk management• Basic knowledge of the Business Continuity Management, Information Security, IT Risk and Identity Access Management• Experience with SCRUM/AGILE/DevOps/LEAN• Moderate oral and written communication skills in English and Dutch
About RabobankRabobank is a bank that is run for clients. Established in the Netherlands, we have grown to become an international financial services provider, active in the area of banking, capital management, leasing, insurance and real estate. We are a cooperative bank with agricultural roots. We know the agricultural sector like no other. Moreover, it is our ambition to be the global leading food and agri bank.
Interested?Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. Are you the Risk Manager we are looking for? If so, apply today! Questions? Feel free to contact account manager Taman Autar (taman@globalpeople.nl / 06 148 611 91).

Introduction
ASML is an innovation leader in the semiconductor industry and provide chipmakers with everything they need – hardware, software and services – to mass produce patterns on silicon through lithography.
The Corporate Real Estate (CRE) Organization is responsible for the transfer of knowledge and qualification of the ASML infrastructure, installation and buildings at our sites.

We are looking for an EHS expert to support our local CRE organization. We are hiring an experienced project lead in the field of Quality and EHS. Are you looking for a challenge and you get energy in making a difference in a fast growing organization.
Can you connect people, are not afraid of taking responsibility and eager to work in a highly professional team within ASML. Join us!

Job Mission
As a project lead (Q)EHS you are responsible to drive quality, environmental, occupational health and Safety related projects as part of the CRE EHS team, located in Veldhoven (NL).
You will coordinate and lead Quality and EHS related projects. You drive projects and connect people from CRE EHS and other CRE departments, like CRE Projects and CRE Facilities and Maintenance.
Projects can relate to: training, Risk assessments (e.g. HAZOPS, RI&E), Standardization and ISO systems (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, HLS), Culture awareness program.


Job Description

As an EHS expert you are responsible to support the CRE organization in the Netherlands to secure safe working in a responsible way for the environment.Act as intermediate between the EHS department and CRE Project department and Facilities and Maintenance department;Coordinate and lead projectteam(s) on (Occupational Health) Risk assessments and Evaluations;Coordinate Training programs (on process, with affinity for IT)Participate in Incident investigations to ensure root cause is identified and appropriate corrective and preventive actions are identified and tracked to closure;Senior for industrial hygienist;Lead program Culture and Safety awareness. Challenge, Cooperate, Care. Contract managen hein-program, represent CRE in corporate initiatives (HR, Corporate EHS).

 Education
You are in possession of (at least) a Bachelor degree, supplemented with Q-EHS education

Experience
Quality and Safety go hand in hand. With your skills, especially leadership and communication skills, you know how to connect people and how to get things done.

5 to 8 years relevant work experience: as project lead and/or (cultural) change manager;Speak the ‘language’ of a Q-EHS specialist;Experienced in one or more of the related fields:
(Occupational Health & Safety) in Risk inventory methods (e.g. IMA-A, JHA), EHS Trainings, and therefore have affinity with IT;ISO standards and safety standards like VCA; Lead auditor is a pre;You have knowledge of applicable local laws and regulations and good analytical problem-solving skills;You are a strong communicator, open, honest and respectful in your communication with others. 
 Personal skills

Project managementSelf-starter, motivated, driver mentality.Stress resistant, social, team player, constructive, accurate.Excellent communication skills (written and oral Dutch and English professional proficiency), ability to interact with external parties.Ability to analyze complex situations and act in a constructive and rational way.Ability to analyze processes and recognize associated risks.

 Context of the position
Reports to: CRE EHS Manager
Manages: No direct reports
Interfaces: ASML management, CRE management, CRE EHS colleagues, ASML EHS colleagues, Contractors.

Other Information

Willing to travel (limited) if required as part ofknowledge sharing with CRE colleagues globally.
Please apply with cv and cover letter.

Zit je vol ambitie en wil jij weten hoe de werkzaamheden van een Real Estate Advisor zijn? Benut jij graag kansen en neem je initiatief? Pak dan deze kans en solliciteer naar deze meeloopstage als Intern Real Estate Advisor!

Wat ga je doen?
Wanneer je bij Colliers aan de slag gaat, kom je te werken in een dynamisch team waar je veel van kunt leren. Als Intern Real Estate Advisor kijk je met jouw collega’s mee naar de verhuur of verkoop van commercieel vastgoed in de regio Amsterdam. Door bij dit team een kijkje in de keuken te nemen zal je ervaren hoe adviezen worden opgemaakt voor de eigenaar, hoe kopers en huurders worden benaderd, hoe bezichtigingen worden georganiseerd en hoe het proces van onderhandeling tot contractmanagement loopt.  Je zal begeleid worden door de Real Estate Agents van het team.

Wat vragen we van jou?

Je bent bezig met de tweede fase van je HBO opleiding in de richting van Bedrijfskunde, Commerciële Economie of Vastgoed & Makelaardij;Je bent eager om te leren;Je bent enthousiast, ondernemend, commercieel vaardig en hebt een groot doorzettingsvermogen;Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal.

Aanvullende informatie

Enthousiast?

Ben jij de Intern die wij zoeken? Dan nodigen we je graag uit om te solliciteren. Heb je vragen over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Roos Poorte via nl.talent@colliers.com of 06 82 48 05 92.

Recruitmentbureaus en zelfstandige recruiters:

We hebben het geluk dat er veel kwalitatieve sollicitanten op onze vacatures reageren. Zo niet, dan zetten we onze eigen search op. Mochten we er echt niet uitkomen, dan hebben we een preferred supplier. We vragen je daarom ook vriendelijk of je ons niet wil bellen met de vraag of jullie ons hierbij kunnen helpen.

Bedrijfsomschrijving

Fashion, fun and action!

As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.

But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business aware planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 5,043 stores in more than 74 markets worldwide.

Vacatureomschrijving

Did you know that our Lease Team takes care of all lease & contract related issues for all our H&M and portfolio brand stores in The Netherlands, such as locations for new stores and existing lease & legal issues?

Our Lease Department includes the complete lease contract management, with content such as space, term and rents for all H&M Stores and New Brands in The Netherlands. For all new- and existing stores (for example in the event of a contract extension) the Lease Team is responsible to negotiate the contract. The exciting task of the lease team is to determine new locations for all Stores within the H&M Group (H&M, COS, WEEKDAY, H&M HOME, &other Stories, MONKI, ARKET) identify, evaluate and carefully analyze them. The aim of the analysis is to determine sustainable, economic success of each store and to rent the optimal location in size, division of space and contract.

The role

You secure the future of our company: because you recognize opportunities to promote and increase turnover and profitability and have an overview of our store portfolio and all rental contract parameters, such as term, conditions, rents, charges and notice periods. You evaluate the location, environment, space size and contractual conditions of our stores and optimize our portfolio through renegotiations, new openings and conversions, among other things.You make your decisions with a view to what is best for the location, the individual brand and our customers and colleagues: Because you develop location strategies and ensure the future-oriented positioning of our stores! You will deal with questions such as "Which new store location will be exciting and relevant for us today and in the future?“You know how an efficient rental contract management looks like - from renting to renegotiation, you lead through the rental contract negotiations and prepare recommendations for a possible contract conclusion for our board in the Region and Sweden. Based on your own initiative you should always have an eye on the customers, the development of the retail sector, the competitors and the “best deal”.Whether we want to rent a store for H&M or for one of our new brands: Because of you, we are welcomed partners! This is the basis for our store teams to inspire our customers in the right environment.

Functie-eisen

Who are you?

You are an open-minded team player who keeps a cool head even in hot situations which are full of energy - this is how you transform everyday new challenges into extraordinary results. When dealing with your colleagues and our external business partners, you have strong communication skills and empathy, you keep an overview, you can set the right priorities and act entrepreneurially. Your communication skills and your assertiveness make you a strong negotiating partner.

 In addition, we would like the following from you:

A completed business degree or a comparable qualification in further educationIdeally, already professional experience in the real estate industry or management consultingA customer- team-oriented and very structured, analytical way of workingGood knowledge of Excel and WordThe ability to communicate fluently in Dutch & English (written and verbal)

Aanvullende informatie

As a person, we believe you are ambitious, competitive, humble, and a fast learner. You are constantly looking for possibilities to improve things and you make sure that things get done before deadlines. You value own responsibility, fast pace working environment, teamwork and straight forward communication. You enjoy working in a global organization with many diverse cultures and backgrounds. And importantly, you are excited about the opportunity – to enable H&M Group to grow faster and optimize our store investments.

The position is full-time and located in Amsterdam.

Are you interested?

For more information or questions, please contact Recruiters-NL@HM.com. Apply via career.hm.com by uploading your CV and cover letter

The Nike European Headquarters serves athletes* across the whole of EMEA. We are looking for engaging and diverse students that are willing to join our team for a 12-month internship starting August 1st. Our ideal candidate will possess great communication skills, show willingness to learn and is not afraid of challenges. Our internships allow students to be fully immersed in meaningful work that impacts the future of the business. To be successful in the role our interns must be self-starters who are willing to drive innovation in order to win as a team.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Being a part of the Nike Direct team is about more than just selling product online. It's about being a part of how Nike shows up to our consumers. It's about getting product in front of the consumer when they want it, where they want it and how they want it. As a Nike Direct intern, you will support the strategic vision of Nike Retail and execute the product assortment, delivering a digital shopping experience in a way that puts the consumer at the center while driving revenue and profitability. You will make it easy for consumers to buy and drive conversion. You will support the team in building partnerships with teammates in Marketing, Buying, Planning, Customer Service, Territories and Global Digital Commerce to deliver a premium retail experience online to our consumers across our digital platforms.

As an intern in one of our digital commerce teams, your tasks and responsibilities may include:
 Identify the latest trends in (digital) retail and the e-commerce world Use trend data & consumer insights to simplify path to product journey Analyze Nike’s current marketplace, competitors, and consumers, as well as market/consumer trends for value retail, and translate analysis and reports into practical recommendations and present your findings Support team during retail moments and initiatives and develop a holistic view of path to product in e-commerce Use Digital Analytics to track key business targets (conversion, traffic, demand) Connect with business stakeholders in other departments, e.g. Marketing, Retail, and be a key partner to enable their business to grow
Qualifications
 3rd/4th year Bachelor or Master’s Degree student within Business Administration, Retail Management, Business Intelligence, E-Commerce, Digital Business, Computer Science, or other related fields Fluency in English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong research, technical and analytical skills, and excellent proficiency with Microsoft Office programs Strong project management skills and ability to bridge between business and technology Proactive, energetic attitude with a passion for e-commerce, retail, sport and fashion Affinity with e-commerce platforms and applications and understanding of their business models Eagerness to be an active part of the team, and ability to take ownership Academic, volunteering, or previous internship experiences related to Retail, E-Commerce, Technology, Project Management or Business Development are a plus (please include in your CV) A global mindset and ideally a passion for sport
IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR AN INTERNSHIP, YOU MUST:
 Be a student for the whole duration of the internship (enrolled in a university/higher education institution) Be available for a 12-month fulltime internship starting August 1st, 2021
Start Date

August 1st, 2021

End Date

August 12th, 2022

To Apply

Click on ‘Apply Now’ to submit your CV in English no later than Monday 5th April 2021.

Useful Information

This internship is open to students outside of the Netherlands.

Successful candidates will be contacted by mid-April for the first stage of the selection (digital assessment). The final interviews will take place throughout May and June.

Please note: We recommend that you only apply for the position you believe you are most suited to, if your skillset is more suitable to a different role, we will consider your application for this position also.

Where legally permissible, you may be asked to consent to a pre-employment screening for this position, which will be conducted in accordance with applicable laws and the Nike Applicant Background

Flink is revolutionizing how we buy groceries. We deliver a selection of 2.000 products to your home - in only 10 minutes. We put customers first and aim to achieve the best customer experience. We only source the highest quality products to ensure everything is fresh and nutritious. Founded by experienced ecommerce professionals and backed by some of the most renowned investors in Europe we are growing rapidly and have a great hunger to continuously challenge ourselves. We are a diverse team with a flexible and inclusive culture.Do you want to be a part of this grocery revolution? Apply now and join Flink
Job Description:
Leading the search for the best warehouse locations in all major cities in the NetherlandsIdentify the right opportunities and close them quickly to support us in becoming the leading quick grocery player in the NetherlandsWork with our managing directors to analyze the financial and operational feasibility of potential new locationsYou are responsible for the whole deal. From finding the property till ready for business.Simultaneously handle a variety of deals across the whole NetherlandsResponsible for negotiation and signing process within the set timeline
Qualifications:
Successfully completed a bachelor’s  or master’s degree and 2–3 years years of experience in retail real estateComfortable working in a high paced environmentStrong real estate network in the NetherlandsOutstanding negotiation skills and proven track record of closing dealsExcellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skillsYou are commercially driven, like to take ownership and are willing to go the extra mileVery good communication skills, native in Dutch and fluent written and spoken in English
What we offer: 
The opportunity to work at one of the best funded startups in the Netherlands, aiming to completely redefine one of the largest categoriesA great opportunity to grow within Flink: As we are growing so quickly new opportunities come every dayAn awesome team spirit and an exciting workplace in the heart of Amsterdam with an inspiring and international environment.Transparent company culture with flat hierarchiesA competitive salary and several other perks like a company boat (soon ;) ), Friday borrel and Monday team lunches20% discount on your own Flink grocery orders
It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Job Title: Client Confidential - Product Specialist Commercial Real Estate
Job Description:
Kandidaatprofiel8+ jaar werkervaringExpert in de Nederlandse markt van zakelijk vastgoedErvaring met opbouwen van leningenportefeuillesCommerciële mindsetErvaring met digitalisatie van processen De Product Specialist Commercial Real Estate krijgt bij de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank de unieke kans om mee te bouwen aan een innovatieve, digital-first bank. Met zijn/haar inhoudelijke expertise en commerciële mindset, bouwt de Product Specialist een commerciële vastgoedportefeuille met solide assets en de juiste risicoafwegingen.
Over de Nieuwe Digitale OndernemersbankOnder de werktitel ‘Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank’ bouwt een ervaren en ambitieus team aan een nieuwe Nederlandse bank. Deze nieuwe bank – op het grensvlak van banking en fintech – helpt ondernemers om in deze macro-economisch en technologisch snel veranderende tijden hun doelen te verwezenlijken.
De typische klant van de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank is een ondernemer met een jaarlijkse omzet tussen de 1 en de 50 miljoen euro. Daarnaast kunnen ook particulieren er terecht. Zij krijgen hier nog ouderwets rente op hun spaargeld en steunen daarmee tegelijkertijd het MKB.De Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank investeert veel in nieuwe technologie. Zo ontwikkelen ze uitstekende digitale dienstverlening die sneller, beter en klantgerichter is dan die van traditionele banken. Daarbij heeft de nieuwe bank oog voor maatwerk: met een sterke klantfocus bieden ze precies wat iedere individuele ondernemer nodig heeft om op lange termijn succesvol te zijn.
“Ons internationaal georiënteerde team heeft veel ervaring in banking, fintech, startups, scale-ups en bij toonaangevende spelers als Amazon en Goldman Sachs. Dankzij deze unieke mix kunnen we hier echt iets revolutionairs neerzetten.” – CEO
De Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank is een startup met een ijzersterke uitgangspositie. Een grote internationale investeerder heeft zich voor tientallen miljoenen gecommitteerd en de nieuwe bank is ook al in het bezit van een Nederlandse banklicentie. Daarmee kan het team een vliegende start maken. Vanuit het hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam zet de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank vernieuwende, digitale proposities neer waarmee het in no time Europa gaat veroveren.
Vacature: Product Specialist Commercial Real EstateDe komende jaren staat er bij de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank maar één thema centraal: groei. De Product Specialist Commercial Real Estate speelt een belangrijke rol in het zorgvuldig, duurzaam en schaalbaar realiseren van dit doel. Hij/zij bouwt – in nauwe samenwerking met de Relationship Director en de CCO – een vastgoedportefeuille op met solide assets en een goede risicobalans.
“De Product Specialist begrijpt de risico’s van commercieel vastgoed als geen ander, maar richt zich tegelijkertijd ook op de kansen. Hij/zij denkt proactief mee over wat er wél kan zonder de risico’s uit het oog te verliezen.” – Chief Customer Officer
De Product Specialist heeft diepe expertise op het gebied van de financiering van zakelijk vastgoed, zowel voor eigen gebruik als voor verhuur. Hij/zij zet die kennis in om deals te structureren en input te geven op de belangrijkste afwegingen. Zo zorgt de Product Specialist dat de deals die de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank aangaat op de lange termijn waarde creëren voor alle partijen en passen binnen het risicobeleid van de bank.
Bij de Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank heeft de Product Specialist de unieke kans om zijn/haar diepe expertise in te zetten in een omgeving die hard groeit. Daarmee krijgt hij/zij alle ruimte om mee te denken over commerciële thema’s en over de inrichting van efficiënte, digitale processen. Alles om ondernemers optimale producten en services te bieden en zo de leningenportefeuille zorgvuldig op te bouwen. Interesse?De Nieuwe Digitale Ondernemersbank werkt voor invulling van deze vacature met Top of Minds.

Job Title: Enterprise Sales Executive, Looker, Google Cloud
Job Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Experience selling enterprise SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) products.

Experience managing business cycles.

Experience qualifying opportunities and positioning software technology to clients.

Preferred qualifications:
Sales experience with data processing workflows, data analytics, business intelligence, and/or data visualization software.

Experience in a collaborative work environment working cross-functionally.
Ability to work towards business goals.

Ability to build and manage customer executive relationships.

Ability to provide coordination and direction to extended teams.

About the jobThe Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Looker is on a mission to bring better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Looker, from our products and technologies, to our ease of doing business and our support. We are looking for curiously brilliant individuals to join our team as we reinvent data analytics. Get data-driven and see yourself at Looker.

As an Enterprise Sales Executive at Looker, you’ll help customers fundamentally change the way they explore and analyze their complex data and build value for their companies in the areas of Data and Analytics/Business Intelligence, reporting, visualization, data exploration/discovery, embedded analytics, and data science.Looker is a unified platform that powers data experiences and delivers actionable business insights to employees at the point of decision. Looker integrates data into the daily workflows of users to allow organizations to extract value from data at web-scale.
Responsibilities
Identify and qualify opportunities for Looker’s “in-database” Business Intelligence software to solve customer Big Data problems.

Define, confirm, and communicate the differentiated value of Looker to the customer at both the technical and business level.

Establish Looker’s ability to deliver business value through reference and use case selling, and proof of concept engagements.

Identify the customer approvers, decision makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase agreement confidence.

Work with tools to maintain a current and accurate pipeline of your early stage, upside, and forecast agreements. Understand the formal and informal buying process in the customer's environment.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Who we are:
Chartboost is the leading in-app monetization and programmatic advertising platform. We reach a mobile audience of over 900 million monthly unique users globally and process over 200 billion ad requests. The Chartboost SDK is the highest-integrated independent mobile ad SDK and through the Chartboost Exchange, Ad Network, DSP and other services, we empower mobile app developers to build businesses, while connecting advertisers to highly engaged audiences.
About the role:
Chartboost is seeking a Head of Demand to drive all sales and customer relationships throughout the EMEA region. The person in this role has the opportunity to lead and drive regional growth, while building new business pipelines and define the regional strategy for demand. Highly successful customer relationships will be critical along with the proven ability to represent market feedback is key. As a senior member of the demand team, this person will ultimately help influence our services, products, offerings in-market. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in mobile advertising and programmatic buying. This experienced leader will have a passion for helping others, experience building and leading teams, and collaborating cross functionally with key stakeholders. This position will be based in our Amsterdam office.
What you’ll do:
Coach and mentor an existing team of experienced Account Managers and Account Executives Source and identify prospects (mobile app/game developers and mobile marketers, etc.), develop a robust pipeline, and close new business. Ideally, this person should be able to come in with a rolodex of contacts within the industryAbility to understand and execute against the customer’s business goals, anticipate future needs and help determine ideal solutions to scale and drive revenue for the companyManage client expectations at all levels and lead customer meetings. Demonstrate a consultative approach in addressing customer needs and expectations while driving towards Chartboost’s company goalsManage and nurture multiple large advertiser accounts within the region. You're not afraid to roll up your sleeves and analyze data and campaign settings to troubleshoot problems for the customerLead external training to enable customers to utilize our products and solutions effectivelyRepresent Chartboost in industry conferences and customer meetings throughout the globe (when safe to do so)Ability to understand product integrations, provide feedback to help improve product performance, and troubleshoot technical or business inquiriesWork closely with our internal technical teams regarding any highly technical queries, and provide customer support
Who you are:
Experienced sales leader with 5+ years in sales (inside/outside/direct), preferably in digital advertising3+ years experience building and/or managing a teamA start-up mentality: you know how to stretch a dollar to grow our existing clients and close deals with new clientsComfortable working in an environment where change happens quickly, with the ability to calibrate and adaptOrganized and methodical, with phenomenal communication skills and a consultative approach in addressing customer needsKnowledge of Salesforce and/or other CRM systemsYou have excellent verbal and written English communications skills  You love learning, you love helping people, and you want to get people excited to use ChartboostA strong and proactive planner, collaborator and organizer, a stickler for details and a master of multitaskingA can-do "make it happen" attitude - you are comfortable making decisions with little supervision or direction
Bonus points:
Experience working in a client services role at a mobile gaming or tech companyExperience selling a programmatic product, solution, and/or offeringFluency in other languagesYou are a gamer and understand the mechanics of games
What we offer:
The opportunity to help build a company with the original teamWork in an incredible, centrally located office near Amsterdam Dam Square, easily accessible by public transport and by carFree daily lunch, drinks, snacks and game room26 days of PTO
More about us:
We are proud of the product we have built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions and always design with the user in mind. Sounds like a fit? Join us, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming!
We are an equal opportunity employer — we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and make our hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek 

Bij Albert Heijn Real Estate zoeken wij stagiaires die veel willen leren over vastgoed, affiniteit hebben met retail en graag werken voor een grote vastgoed organisatie binnen Nederlands grootste en bekendste Retailer. Wil jij graag stage lopen binnen een gezellig team en trots zijn op het bedrijf waar je stage loopt? Solliciteer dan bij ons!

Dit ga je bij ons doen

Tijdens deze meeloopstage binnen het team Asset Management krijg je een goed beeld van het werk op de vastgoedafdeling van Albert Heijn, Etos en Gall & Gall. De stage is gericht op een wederzijdse kennismaking tussen het bedrijf en de student. Je levert een bijdrage aan alle lopende werkzaamheden, bent onderdeel van het team en dus aanwezig bij overleggen, workshops en trainingen. Je krijgt ruimte om te ontdekken wat werken bij Albert Heijn Real Estate inhoudt en leert de vastgoedwensen van Albert Heijn (Nederland en België), Etos en Gall & Gall kennen. Een aantal van je taken zullen zijn

Ondersteuning verlenen bij het beheren van onze eigendoms- en aanhuurportefeuilleOpstellen van aan- en verhuurcontracten alsmede allongesBieden van ondersteuning bij aan- en verkooptransactiesHelpen bij het oplossen en voorkomen van commerciële, technische en contract administratieve beheer issuesContact met zowel onze winkels als onze (ver)huurders"

Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Albert Heijn, onderdeel van Ahold Delhaize, is de nummer 1 food retailer van Nederland. Met meer dan 1000 winkels in Nederland en België en 24/7 op ah.nl zijn wij er altijd en overal voor onze miljoenen klanten. Om in te blijven spelen op het continu veranderende leven van onze klant, ontwikkelen we iedere dag nieuwe manieren van (online) boodschappen doen met de meest moderne technieken. Samen gaan we voor meer klant impact.

Bij Albert Heijn Real Estate draait het elke dag om de klant en hoe wij deze met het beste winkel- en logistieke netwerk kunnen bedienen. Een filmpje over Albert Heijn Real Estate vind je hier https //www.youtube.com/watch?v=w7DskF-5I9k. De afdeling Real Estate is onderverdeeld drie onderdelen Portfolio Management, Expansie Management en Asset Management. Gezamenlijk dragen deze afdelingen zorg voor het verwerven, (her)ontwikkelen en managen van de winkel- en logistieke portefeuille. Portfolio Management draagt zorg voor het strategisch en tactische beleid, Expansie richt zich voornamelijk op verwerving van (nieuwe) locaties en Asset Management verzorgt de optimalisatie van het bestaande winkelnetwerk.

Normaliter werk je vanuit ons bruisende hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Vanwege de huidige situatie is thuis jouw nieuwe werkplek.

 Dit bieden we jou 

Interessante en veelzijdige stageplaats voor 5 of 6 maanden per augustus/september;Veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen initiatieven;Een kijkje op de afdeling waar meegedacht en –gewerkt kan worden aan alle vernieuwingen en verbetering voor de winkel en de medewerker;De Ahold Delhaize internship experience (borrels, events en netwerken met alle stagiairs binnen het hoofdkantoor);Goede stage- en reiskostenvergoeding (450-500 euro per maand plus reiskostenvergoeding);Stage waarin je échte werkervaring opdoet in het veld!;Deze stageplek biedt geen mogelijkheden tot afstuderen.


 Dit breng je mee 

Bij ons werk je voor een van de grootste retailers ter wereld. Naast een ‘hands on’ mentaliteit en een leergierige, energieke houding, vragen wij

HBO of WO werk- en denkniveauBezig met een bij voorkeur vastgoed gerelateerde studieAffiniteit met retail én vastgoedUitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardighedenZelfstandig, initiatiefrijk, doortastend en doelgericht
Solliciteer en kom binnen

Werken bij Albert Heijn betekent flexibel samenwerken. Vanuit huis en op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Wil je meebouwen aan het succes van Albert Heijn? Solliciteer direct, en zeker vóór 4 april.
We willen je vragen om geen standaard motivatiebrief te sturen, maar een antwoord te formuleren op de volgende vragen
 Waarom zou je bij Albert Heijn stage willen lopen? Waarom denk jij dat je geschikt bent voor deze stageplek? Vermijd woorden die in deze vacaturetekst staan en houd het persoonlijk. Wat is een van je sterke punten en welke vaardigheid zou je (verder) willen ontwikkelen tijdens deze stage?

Eerst meer weten voordat je de stap maakt? vertelt je meer over deze vacature via . Algemene vragen over stages kan je mailen naar stage@aholddelhaize.com

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 155 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.

JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT
The Storage & real estate Analyst, will assistant in developing and executing processes to capture, organize and analyze information for the Storage & real estate department. We seek a motivated professional who will support in assisting in developing, implementing, and maintaining Storage & Real Estate best practices, tools, and templates. You will be interacting with multiple business units and close collaborate from the Schiphol office, and you will directly report into Storage & Real Estate Regional Lead.

Key Accountabilities
 Support and enable the storage & real estate strategy with respect to vendor management and analyze recommended solutions to optimize strategy, projects and supplier performance Apply a meaningful understanding of transportation and logistics practices and procedures to assist in negotiating freight prices and contract terms for customers. Update metrices and databases for contracts, freight rates and estimates, insurance information, customer information, etc. Independently analyze current market data and best practices to resolve process and cost improvement opportunities. Independently handle moderately issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned 

Minimum Qualifications
 Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience in transportation, logistics, operations or supply chain and or related fields Strong analytical skills and experience with metrics and or scorecards, preferably including understanding of financial modeling and acumen 

Preferred Qualifications
 Master Degree in business logistics, transportation, supply chain or related field  Understanding of transportation and warehouse/ terminal operations in combination with industrial real estate and or asset management Ability to understand and prioritize business- strategic issues and impact in combination of working multiple tasks with a strong client and customer focus Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills  Experience in negotiations and or 3rd party vendor management and or knowledge of the food/agricultural business is a pre Fluent in English, any other language (Dutch, German, French) is a pre 

Our Offer
In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.
Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill

Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more: https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

Job Title: Internship Strategy (Real Estate and Portfolio Management)
Job Description:
Location: Amsterdam or Eindhoven - Depending on the possibility to work at the office due to the COVID-19 pandemic, for the time being you will mainly work from home and be supervised remotely.​
Type: Internship, not suitable for thesis
Length: 6 months or longer
Time: 40 hours/week
Expected Start Date: Mid-April 2021 
 In this role, you have the opportunity toPut your communication and analytical skills and business acumen into practice with a global leader in Health Technology and build your interpersonal and business skills with support from all that Philips has to offer. You will contribute by delivering valuable insights to Philips Real Estate that drive strategic decision-making for Philips businesses, markets and functions. In addition, you will support to improve data management practices and documentation and increase data accuracy.You are responsible for
Collaborating on the strategic ‘office of the future’ plan in which we investigate how the pandemic is impacting our way of working by gathering local intel and executing the appropriate analysis (survey).Improving data management and system documentation and data quality in the Real Estate domain.Assist the Real Estate Intelligence team on strategic deep-dives and provide high quality and meaningful recommendations.
You are a part ofThe Strategy, M&A and Innovations team within the Philips Real Estate function. A team that cooperates with a large variety of Businesses, Markets and other functional teams across the Philips spectrum.To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience
Pursuing a Master’s degree in Economics, Marketing, Communication, Finance or similar with an excellent academic track record.Genuine interest in real estate and strategy.Proven highly analytical mindset and a strong ‘get-things-done’ drive.Urge to turn large amounts of data into sensible recommendations and be able to communicate these in a clear and concise manner.Ability to quickly understand technology and translate this into clear documentation/user guides for end users.Programming skills with the R programming language are appreciated but not mandatory (proven aptitude to pick this up quickly).Experience with Business Analytics (e.g. big-data management, data quality controls, etc.).Neat MS-Powerpoint and advanced Excel skillsBusiness fluent in the English language, both written and spoken.
In return, we offer youA unique opportunity to experience Philips from a strategic, broad and diverse corporate global perspective. You will experience your time with Philips as both exciting and challenging as responsibilities rapidly increase for those who perform well. We also offer you a well above average internship compensation.Important:
Please note that in order to be considered for an internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation (proof of enrollment) will be requested. Students from outside the EU need to fill in an NUFFIC agreement, which needs to be signed by the student and the university. Please note that the contents of our regular internship assignments are not suitable for professionals (and/or MBA students) with professional work experience. 
 Why should you join Philips?Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Ace & Tate is looking for a Real Estate Specialist to support the Retail Expansion team by managing the portfolio and acquiring new retail locations. The new stores will be rolled out throughout Europe according to the company's location search profile and growth goals. This role is not a regular 9 to 5 desk job, but requires frequent international travel. (obviously this is currently impacted by Covid-19)

The position is full-time and immediately available.

You’ll be…
Pro-actively managing the existing portfolio - 70 stores in Europe in 10 different markets - and continuously optimising the portfolio based on store performance.Researching existing and new markets to determine the best expansion strategy supported by internal & external data.Leading the search for new locations by managing all involved external parties as landlords, brokers and other retailers.Responsible for setting up business cases for new locations & liaising with internal stakeholders to determine financial and operational feasibility.Presenting approval decks on potential new locations to senior management.Responsible for closing deals for new locations within the set strategy & timeline.Within the retail expansion team leading all communication with internal project managers, architects and designers regarding new locations.The point of contact for landlords within Ace & Tate.Responsible for finalising lease agreements, together with our Legal, Finance and Retail Operations departments.Reviewing and analysing recent store performance after opening and sharing insights & potential next steps in order to improve the expansion strategy.Traveling extensively throughout existing and new markets.Reporting to the Retail Expansion Director. You...
Have 5 years of commercial real estate deal-making experience preferably with a high-growth international retailer.Have experience in managing an international real estate portfolio including rent renewals. Are fluent in English, other European languages are a big plus.Are skilled in Microsoft Excel and Tableau or similar data visualisation software.Have an analytical mind and know how to filter & present data. Are a deal maker and who doesn’t take no for an answer.Have broad technical and legal knowledge.Have a strong real estate network in Europe. Have the ability to operate independently with a large amount of individual responsibility and initiative.Are used to working under high pressure and see tight deadlines as an exciting challenge.Have a natural feel for the Ace & Tate brand and identity.We offer you the chance to...
Be part of a dynamic and ambitious international team that opened 70 stores.Set the basis to take the expansion of Ace & Tate to the next level.Explore Europe and work in different markets.Update your eyewear collection frequently!Jeez, that was a lot. Still with us? If you are, and you’re thinking that you might just fit this exact profile, please apply via the form below. We’d love to hear from you.

Please note that we are not interested in working with recruitment agencies for this position.

Ace & Tate is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment for all current and potential employees.

Job Description

Are you a results-driven sales enthusiast who speaks German fluently and gets a kick of expanding a business internationally? Gut! Hör zu: we’re currently looking for our very first Enterprise Account Executive DACH, whose goal is to open up the market in the DACH region and land new customers. You will have significant interaction with clients and create and maintain a solid new business sales pipeline by identifying new business opportunities. Closing new logos and solution selling is the key to success for this role.

Zivver makes communication simple & secure, and it’s your job to make our business grow. This fast-growing scale-up is accelerating like a rocket and needs enthusiastic, self-sufficient and experienced professionals like you to go even faster. How? By joining our well-established sales machine, improving our go-to-market approach, utilising your existing network to identify decision-making units and execute. Sounds good? It is. But, wait. There’s more.

Hot takes

 You don’t try to sell a Porsche to someone without a drivers’ license Deutsche Pünktlichkeit makes you happy Building pipeline is your second nature An untidy CRM makes you itchy

A day at HQ

After taking the final sip of your coffee, you check if new messages came in via Email or Social channels on your outbound efforts. You follow up to the ones that did and schedule in product presentations, building your pipeline. Hunting for new business is one of your main tasks, perhaps you use Xing or Linkedin, build proper lead lists and start reaching out to prospects.

Lunch break? Check. After lunch, you’ve scheduled an important meeting with our German Marketing Manager to discuss what marketing activities they can run in Germany, for the upcoming weeks. Your colleague

Then you get a call from one of our major German Healthcare clients, who wants to discuss the upcoming webinar on information security in Germany. You finish your day with a meeting with the whole Sales team. You exchange tips & tricks, experiences that worked in the past and have a good laugh, too. If you thought you couldn't end your day any better, your manager praises you for sealing the deal with a new customer you signed in Germany. Sip, sip, hooray! What a great way to kick off your weekend.

Responsibilities
 You’re Zivver’s go-to spokesperson within the DACH region Identify target customers, use effective ways to convert those new business leads and arrange meetings Identify customers’ needs and respond effectively with a plan Quickly build customer trust and identify appropriate stakeholders in customer’s organization Prepare and deliver customer presentations and demonstrations of Zivver’s portfolio Negotiate proposals with customers Provide support to our customers in their decision process, offering clear advice and solutions Carry out sales forecast and analysis and present your findings to Management via Salesforce Last but not least: meet quarterly and yearly targets set by management and contributing to team targets 

Benefits
 An exciting, fast-growing, energetic environment Impact on a whole region, starting from day one Working remotely (or from our office in Amsterdam, when this pandemic is hopefully over) Flexible working hours A pension plan Free lunch (if you’re working at our office) Training and learning opportunities 

Requirements

Experience
 3+ years’ experience in an (Enterprise) sales role, of which at least 2 years in an expansion role in a fast paced and competitive market Native German speaker Proven record in selling SaaS technology in the DACH region Experience with sales processes and using CRM (experience with Salesforce is required) Experience working in collaboration and/or product development is a big plus 

Attitude / Personality
 You are a natural closer who enjoys rolling up your sleeves, ensuring this scale-up doesn’t just go to the moon but way beyond It’s true, you can’t deny it, you’ve got a track record in overachievement  You’ve got some exceptional relation building skills

Medior Juridisch ondersteuner/secretaresse notariaat (2-4 jaar)

Ben jij een organisatorisch en gestructureerd talent? En heb jij al enige jaren ervaring als notarieel ondersteuner? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Voor de uitbreiding & versterking van de praktijkgroep Real Estate in Amsterdam, zijn wij op zoek naar een secretaresse.

In deze functie binnen de praktijkgroep Real Estate ondersteun je onder meer kandidaat-notarissen in de dagelijkse praktijk en werk je samen aan het begeleiden van (grote) vastgoedtransacties. Het is een veelzijdige functie met een breed takenpakket en geen enkele dag is hetzelfde. Inhoudelijk is het interessant werk en je zal veel kennis opdoen van het notariaat en het vastgoedrecht. Er heerst een open, informele sfeer waar men gelijkwaardig met elkaar omgaat en waar collegialiteit prioriteit heeft. Het werk vereist een scherpe blik met oog voor detail. Als je de processen leert kennen, dan kan je bepaalde taken naar je toe trekken. Iedereen werkt namelijk op zijn eigen niveau.
 Dit ga je doen als secretaresse 
 Het aanmaken van dossiers; cliënten invoeren in het systeem, registers raadplegen zoals de Gemeentelijke Basisadministratie, curateleregister, faillissementsregister, rechercheren bij het Kadaster, uittreksels/statuten opvragen bij de Kamer van Koophandel, zowel digitaal als hard copy; Het bijhouden van dossiers zowel digitaal als hard copy; Monitoren van de retournering van volmachten/stukken en het controleren van de tekenbevoegdheid; Het klaar maken van de akten voor ondertekening en vervolgens diverse taken ter afhandeling van het dossier (versturen van stukken naar cliënten / wijzigingen doorvoeren bij de kamer van koophandel); Je bewaakt het overzicht in de te hanteren procedures binnen een dossier. Het zelfstandig opstellen van stukken (denk hierbij aan, volmachten, besluiten en royementsakten); Telefonisch contact met cliënten en externe instanties (Kamer van Koophandel, kadaster, rechtbanken, banken en adviseurs); Het uitwerken/verzorgen van correspondentie (Nederlands én Engels); Je hebt een controlerende- en een signalerende rol bij de identificatie van cliënten conform de Wwft –regelgeving; Opstellen van declaraties; Verzorgen van legalisaties; Archiveren van dossiers; Agendaplanning voor de (kandidaat)notarissen. 

Kortom: een veelzijdige functie met een inhoudelijk karakter!
 Deze vacature is echt iets voor jou, want jij (hebt) 
 2-4 jaar werkervaring binnen het notariaat met een affiniteit in vastgoed; Proactief, accuraat, flexibel en stressbestendig; Behoudt het overzicht en herkent bij drukte prioriteiten; Hebt goede digitale vaardigheden, niemand hoeft jou iets uit te leggen over het Microsoft Office pakket; je bent zeer bedreven in Word, Excel en PowerPoint; Uitstekende taalvaardigheid in zowel Nederlands als Engels.   Hier ga je werken als secretaresse in Amsterdam 
Loyens & Loeff heeft onder meer een zeer hoogwaardige en innovatieve vastgoedpraktijk die opereert in de top van de markt. Onze cliëntenkring bestaat uit grote spelers op het gebied van het vastgoed, waaronder beleggers, banken, fondsen en overheden. De werkzaamheden bestaan uit het adviseren van deze instanties bij vastgoed gerelateerde vraagstukken.
 Dit bieden we je 
 Een moderne, informele en internationale werkomgeving, goed bereikbaar met OV; Goede doorgroeimogelijkheden en een ruim opleidingsbudget; Een marktconform salaris; Een volle maand vakantiegeld en een feestdagenuitkering in december; Een fietsregeling; Uitstekende extra’s zoals: sportfaciliteiten en gratis fruit op het werk.  Wie zijn wij? 
Loyens & Loeff is een onafhankelijke aanbieder van juridische diensten waar fiscalisten, advocaten en notarissen samenwerken aan geïntegreerde dienstverlening op het gebied van recht in de Benelux en Zwitserland. Zowel grote en middelgrote, nationaal en internationaal opererende ondernemingen alsmede particulieren worden op juridisch gebied bedient. Wereldwijd werken er 1500 medewerkers waarvan ruim 850 specialisten, fiscalisten, advocaten en notarissen in 6 kantoren in de thuismarkt en in 8 vestigingen in de belangrijke financiële centra in de wereld, Europa, Azië en de Verenigde Staten. De organisatie onderhoudt intensieve relaties met gerenommeerde internationale advocatenkantoren en belastingadvieskantoren.
 Solliciteer op deze vacature in Amsterdam 
Enthousiast geworden? Reageer via de solliciteer-button. Vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met onze Senior Recruiter Marieke Arets (0612245296 of Marieke.Arets@loyensloeff.com ).

Graag ontvangen we jouw sollicitatie vóór 15 februari.

Acquisitie op basis van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

TitleBusiness Development Manager Your role at WundermartWundermart is looking for an entrepreneurial and flexible Business Development Manager for hotel/ office key accounts. In this rol you will be responsible for managing one of our most important clients. The business development manager must develop and maintain a strong relationship with stakeholders at all levels of the key account. She/he will be the lead of the account, anticipate client’s needs and translate these into opportunities for Wundermart. Moreover, she/he works within the company to ensure deadlines for the client are met and helps the client to succeed. She/he will also bring in new business from existing clients or contacts and will develop new relationships with potential clients. Here is what you will do as Business Development ManagerDevelop a solid and trusting relationship with your (global) key account on all levels within the organisationAct on a global level and work with different cultures and peopleDevelop a complete understanding of your key account’s needs, anticipate account’s changes and improvements to generate business opportunitiesNegotiate contracts with the client and agree on roll-out planCollaborate with the business development team to maximize growth, turnover and profitsCooperate with other teams to help continuously improve our customer value propositionPlan and present reports on account’s progress, goals, and quarterly initiatives
Our ideal candidateHas a senior levelHas a minimum of 8 years working experience in a commercial environmentPreferably has relevant experience in the hospitality and commercial real estateIs experienced in setting targets, developing business plans and execute themIs able to set priorities and work within multiple disciplinary teamsHas at least a Bachelor degree and preferably in business administration, finance and/ or sales & marketing Our mission At Wundermart we are always asking ourselves whether there is a ‘better way’. By creating an unmanned shopping experience delivered by smart tech and inspired by human insight, we bring 24/7 access to little moments of enjoyment to guests in the world of hospitality. We thrive at the intersection of physical locations (from hotels and offices to hospitals), retail and smart tech. At the heart of this all are the people who work at stay at or visit these locations. Human wants and needs are the foundation of our products and services.

Our valuesTo reach our mission we are building a strong collaborative team. We have established 6 core values we believe define us:Open mindsDare to make mistakesValue over cashAlways learning, always growingNever settleCreate your own destiny

‘Wunder’ is the term that captures our mentality. The ability to see new possibilities. The drive to make something happen that makes a difference and evokes a sense of wonder. Asking questions is the starting point of progress. Asking better questions unlocks real innovation. We never settle with the status quo - we’re challenging it. Our rocket fuel is seeing new opportunities to create better solutions for existing problems.
Are you ready to rock the boat along with us?Please reach out to us! Send an application to recruitment@wundermart.io

Job Description

You are the go-to person when it comes to international buying and supplier selection. You are part of our EMEA sourcing team, consisting of 3 experienced sourcing managers.

Your Team And Responsibilities

As a buyer, you are responsible for excellent buying conditions and processes for our products that are offered in our loyalty programs. You make sure there is sufficient capacity available at the most optimal location. You manage the supplier relationships and develop new ones and take care that all products and suppliers are compliant with International, local and BrandLoyalty requirements.

Buying process

You are an expert of the supplier market of your product categories and constantly monitoring the cost drivers of your products;You are responsible for winning negotiations in pricing, delivery conditions, payment terms (Condition of Purchase) with existing and new suppliers;You coordinate the buying process for products: Product Specifications, supplier selecting and contracting, Streamline the production process and delivery;You ensure product quality in compliance with country- and client specific requirements, together with our QA department.

Vendor Risk ManagementYou manage relationships with our partners; suppliers in the EMEA region;You are responsible for close monitoring of the supplier market, initiate finding new suppliers to secure future sources;You perform factory audits at potential suppliers in collaboration with QA team;You are responsible for the full Vendor Risk management process including contract management.

Product developmentYou are part of our category sourcing teams (consisting of Product Management/ Sourcing Management/QA) support and execute feasibility studies and product development with suppliers following the product development milestones;You are the source of input to our category sourcing teams for product knowledge/technical questions and ideation/new concepts from supplier knowledge/supplier market;Together with the Quality& Compliance manager you are responsible for product testing, setting the norms for inspection by writing a supplier handbook;You are responsible for completion of logistical details + product details including BOM (bill of material) for new products.

Program preparation, planning and executionYou give input in the lead management phase on possibilities of new production, lead times, capacity and MOQ;You keep track of programme performance via Supply Chain Management to anticipate on performance changes and the impact on supplier /deliveries;You are the main contact towards supplier in case of escalations during the programme.

Job Requirements

What qualities do you bring?

HBO or University Degree;4+ years of experience in international buying/sourcing, trading or merchandising in consumer products;Technical product/supplier knowledge in the requested relevant categories (cookware/ovenware/bakeware and/or glassware/dinnerware/(glass/plastic) food storage/textiles;Strong negotiation skills, winning mentality, aiming for Win-Win;Used to work in an international environment;Willingness to travel frequently;Excellent English language skills, verbal and written;Knowledge of SAP is a plus.
What do we offer?

Are you up for the challenge? BrandLoyalty wants you to have fun in your work, contribute to our growth and share the successes with your team/company. This is just a short list of what BrandLoyalty can offer you:

Happy people: happy colleagues, happy consumers, happy clients!Personal & professional development opportunities within a multinational growth business.Work a team with 50+ nationalities in over 55 countries around the world.Part of a Fortune 500 company... with a young & agile attitude.Exceptional terms of employment – compensation, on-site gym with personal trainers, healthy daily lunches cooked by an in-house team and spectacular team gathering.official job title on contract will be Sourcing Manager

BrandLoyalty is known for being a diverse & inclusive workplace because we believe that this drives our purpose “Next Generation Happiness” and creates a better future every day for our employees, clients, and partners. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or disability.

Company Description

IQ-EQ is a leading Investor Services group which combines global expertise with an unwavering focus on client service delivery. We support fund managers, global companies, family offices and private clients operating worldwide.

Job Description

Drawing on your existing experience in Corporate, Company or Fiscal law you will be responsible for coordinating the day to day administrative and legal formalities for our varied and complex client portfolios. This will include regulated and unregulated real estate and corporate entities including funds, trusts and companies.

You’ll be highly organized, pay close attention to detail and know your subject matter as you will be dealing with queries relating to account opening, acquisitions, board resolutions, official publication and filing, notarial and private deeds, incorporation and liquidations.

You will build strong customer relationships with existing and new clients, banks and other external parties, gaining insight into their needs and delivering customer-centric solutions also ensuring we meet our legal and contractual requirements.

Compliance and regulations has never been more complex; you’ll need to ensure we comply and meet our KYC obligations by preparing, monitoring and maintaining robust client files, safeguarding from potential risks.

You will lead board and shareholders meetings, reviewing related minutes, agreements and documentation while preparing internal and external legal documents.

We are never complacent and always encourage our people to look for ways to improve our business; here everyone’s opinion counts and we will value your contribution.

About PVH Corp. 

PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world.

We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good.

Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric intimates brand. True&Co. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.

 About Tommy Hilfiger 

Tommy Hilfiger, which was acquired by PVH Corp. in 2010, is a global apparel and retail company with more than 16,000 associates worldwide. With the support of strong global consumer recognition, Tommy Hilfiger has built an extensive distribution network in over 90 countries and more than 1,400 retail stores throughout North America, Europe, Latin America and the Asia Pacific region. Global retail sales of the Tommy Hilfiger brand were $9.2 billion in 2019

Founded in 1985, Tommy Hilfiger delivers premium styling, quality and value to consumers worldwide with a brand portfolio that includes TOMMY HILFIGER and TOMMY JEANS.

Tommy Hilfiger is one of the world’s most recognized premium designer lifestyle groups and is recognized for celebrating the essence of “classic American cool” style, featuring preppy with a twist designs.

Its focus is designing and marketing high-quality men’s tailored clothing and sportswear, women’s collection apparel and sportswear, kidswear, denim collections, underwear (including robes, sleepwear and loungewear), footwear and accessories. Through select licensees, Tommy Hilfiger offers complementary lifestyle products such as eyewear, watches, fragrance, swimwear, socks, small leather goods, home goods and luggage.

The Team
The Buying Operations team is responsible for managing the global Tommy Hilfiger purchase orders. This team works in close collaboration with the Buying and Planning teams, Sourcing teams, Vendors and inbound teams.

The Position
Ensuring correct and timely Purchase order placement and confirming agreed delivery datesMonitor Purchase orders status through different Systems and Tools, SAP, Infor Nexus and VMS, follow up to ensure on Time Delivery and Arrival and inform stakeholders as requiredPo Maintenance related to On Time Delivery dates, mode of transport, delay reasons etc in SAP Maintaining close relationships with vendors and global sourcing Hubs to understand PO status and specific Vendor and Country of origin challenges and opportunitiesAssessing impact of over- and under shipment and negotiating discounts or re-production with vendors or sourcing hubsMonitoring, reporting and able to explain KPI’s statusMaintaining good working relationship with internal up and downstream teams, Planning and Buying team, Inbound team, Order fulfilment team

 The Ideal Candidate 
Education: HBO / University degree or equivalent in Business, supply chain, Logistics.Minimum 1 year of relevant working experience in a fast-moving international environmentExperience in Fashion industry and/or Supply Chain is an advantageProficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint), Advanced Excel skills requiredAnalytical and result orientated mind-setHigh level of accuracy and problem-solving skillsComfortable working under pressure with deadlinesProactive, supportive, and hands-on mentalityExcellent communication skills in English

A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities

We’re Getir, the pioneers of super-fast delivery. We deliver groceries such as sandwiches to shampoo, dog food to beer, in an average of ten minutes. Founded in 2015, we now deliver hundreds of thousands of orders a day from more than 300 locations in the United Kingdom and Turkey. While this is incredibly valuable for the millions of users we have, operationally it is also an incredibly difficult task. However, it’s a difficult task that we happily embrace. It requires a great deal of on-the-ground work related to retail. We’re in the business of retail, without being standard retail.
Having recently successfully launched our business in London, we’re on the move and looking to expand. Proximity is an important aspect of our business, and finding the right locations can be a daunting task. However as an organization, we’re quite good and either enjoying these difficult tasks or finding ways to make them easier. Understanding how a city operates is also important for our business, so that we may adapt to its realities. Therefore, we are always looking to onboard new, awesome people with local experiences to join our team on this adventure.
If you’ve spent years in the real estate and/or property development/management industry in The Randstad, you’re the person we’re looking for! Here are some details about the job:
What You’ll Do At Getir
Leverage your existing network and insights of the Randstad region to find properties that are suitable for the unique Getir business model.Over time, build and develop a team that is able to source property candidates swiftly and efficiently.Oversee the operational aspects of getting a property from candidacy to up and running, coordinating with relevant legal counsels, regulators, and company stakeholders wherever necessary. Own the process.Do not take for granted existing time frames for doing business. Always try to find a way to do things faster. Speed is our currency here at Getir.As previously mentioned, own the whole process in getting a place up and running. If this includes hiring, lend a hand. If it includes indirect purchasing, take the initiative. We don’t operate with limited responsibilities here at Getir but rather focus on getting stuff done.While taking one property from it’s second to third stage, still be initiating the first stage for new properties. You’ll be expected to go to multiple sites, and will be provided the means to do it.
What Getir Expects From You
Enjoy being out on the field, that hustle and bustle.Great communication and negotiation skills. Getting the right place, and the right conditions, can often be a matter of whether the communication is done well or not.Go beyond just your area of expertise and provide valuable insights and opinions about other areas related to the business and the team. We’ll operate with a small-team startup mindset so everyone’s invited to bring all of themselves to work everyday.A bias towards action and getting things done. Strategy is great, but quite meaningless if not executed upon. Develop both a strategy for property development, and execute upon it.Fluency in both Dutch and English, the operating language of our international people organization. We houden van Nederland.
What Getir Offers
The once in a lifetime chance to work in a people-first startup environment, in a business that is set to revolutionize how people shop for their groceries.

How you can make your markYou can make your mark as a Trainee if you want to learn, encounter and experience a lot in a short period of time. As a Trainee you will be part of the tendering-, engineering- or operational phase of a Dredging or Offshore Energy project. Examples of projects you might contribute to are the port development project Tuas Terminal Finger Pier 3 in Singapore or the Kincardine floating wind farm project in Scotland.
During the tendering- and engineering phase you will act as a Trainee Engineer and translate client requirements to optimal economic proposals, technical designs and work methods. Naturally, you manage the proposed solution to be competitive, ‘fit for purpose’ with regards to engineering and completed within the given timeframe.
During the operational phase of a project, you will work as a Trainee Superintendent or Trainee Project Engineer. It’s your task to make the necessary preparations for a project to start. You will, together with your colleagues, supervise and manage the project work, ensuring that high-quality work is delivered in time. Our fleet consists of around 900 vessels and pieces of machinery; assets you will work closely with in the operational phase. In the role of Trainee Superintendent there is a good chance you will be flying out to work on a multidisciplinary project. 
Your work environment depends on the project. Committed to an Offshore Energy project, you will be located at our head office in Papendrecht. You might spend longer consecutive periods onboard of a vessel.Assigned to a Dredging project, you will work on location for six weeks at a stretch. After, you will have four weeks of leave. 
As a Trainee you will be exposed to assignments/projects in both Dredging and Offshore Energy.Please click here for more information about the Boskalis Traineeship. 
Your qualitiesThis is what you need to make your mark as a Trainee:  
Fully completed a University of Applied Sciences BSc (hbo) or Academic University BSc/MSc (wo) degree in Civil Engineering (Hydraulic Engineering, Structural Engineering), Offshore & Dredging Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Marine Engineering, Land & Water Management or Maritime Officer.Recently graduated (with 0 to 2 years of relevant work experience). You are a EU citizen. A work permit is not sufficient since it restricts you in your work movements, making the International Boskalis Traineeship unfeasible.Be available full-time as of the 1st of September 2021, having obtained your BSc/MSc degree.Good level of English.Willing to spend extended periods abroad or onboard of a vessel. About BoskalisWorking at Boskalis is about creating new horizons and sustainable solutions. In a world where population growth, increase of global trade, demand for (new) energy and climate change are driving forces, we challenge you to make your mark in finding innovative and relevant solutions for complex infrastructural and marine projects.
Within a vibrant company culture, you will be working as part of a diverse, international team of experts. We offer you the opportunity to realize your full personal potential and expand your professional career by creating new horizons. Together.
What you can expectBoskalis Traineeship: Lots of impact on megatrends and lots of growth opportunities. That’s what the Boskalis Traineeship is all about. The Traineeship lasts a total of 18 months during which you will complete three different challenging international assignments, tailored to your study and background. Money and more: Besides salary you will receive holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of at least 25 days, non-contributory pension scheme, collective schemes such as collective health insurance and foreign posting terms. The Boskalis campus: Boskalis is located in Papendrecht, where all our disciplines come together on-campus. Covid-19 affects the way we work and therefore we can’t make use of the benefits of our campus. We don’t know how the world looks like in September, but hopefully, we can access the campus at the start of the Traineeship. Young Boskalis: This is a platform created for and by the Young Boskalis generation. The Young Boskalis Board focus is to represent young employees and look after their integration into the Boskalis family across the various divisions. Every year Young Boskalis organizes various activities, ranging from an online Pub Quiz and a virtual vessel visit, to sport sessions like Yoga and Bootcamp. Warm welcome: We warmly welcome our new colleagues, so they feel at home as soon as possible. During your online onboarding program, we give you all the ins and outs of Boskalis!
Extra informationWhere you will work: Due to Covid-19 the rule "working from home unless" is the norm. This means you will carry out your work from home, collaborating via Microsoft Teams. Eventually, depending on the circumstances in September, you might be able to work from our campus in Papendrecht or a project location (overseas) or onboard of a vessel. Procedure: Apply online via our website before Monday April 5th to secure you are considered for this great opportunity. Please send your CV and personal motivation in which you indicate the following: What makes you apply for Boskalis? What makes you apply for the Boskalis Traineeship instead of a regular job? 
As of Friday April 9th you will be informed if you made it to the next phase.

Job Description:
, Netherlands
