Job Description

Where you fit in

Shell Asset Management Company B.V. (SAMCo) in Rijswijk is the dedicated in-house asset manager for the Royal Dutch Shell Group sponsored pension funds and insurance companies and currently manages around USD 90 billion of assets for its clients. SAMCo is supervised by the authority for the Financial Markets (AFM) and the Dutch Central Bank (DNB). The company is internationally oriented with clients in 10 different countries and approximately 160 employees.

SAMCo’s objective is to provide high quality and cost-effective investment advice and asset management services to its clients. On behalf of its clients, SAMCo invests in fixed income, equities and alternative investment categories such as private equity, real estate and hedge funds, globally. Specific parts of the activities can be outsourced to external managers. Continuous change in financial markets and regulations, as well as the diversity of SAMCo’s clients and the products they invest in, make it a professionally challenging environment to work in.

What’s the role? 

You will be a member of the Externally Managed Funds department, that next to the externally managed liquid investments team include the Hedge Fund, Real Estate, Private Equity teams. The liquid investments team is responsible for the sourcing and monitoring of the external mandates in equities and fixed income securities. These mandates can be passive as well as actively managed portfolios in fundamental as well as quantitative strategies with high risk budgets being allocated to each of them. Your role which sits in the larger team will assist on managing ca. USD 30 billion across more than 40 strategies in over 60 individual portfolios. Currently the team selects and monitors external managers for 8 internal clients as well as assists Group Pensions in evaluating local asset managers. You and the team will also support SAMCo advisory clients in managing their total portfolio, such as cashflow management and rebalancing activities, and reporting.

Additionally, Your Responsibilities Will Include
Acting as lead PM for several external mandates in liquid strategies (fixed income, equities, hedge funds)Initiating and/or lead new external manager searchesDriving further improvements in the investment processInteracting with other Front Office departments as well as other SAMCo departments (Legal, Back and Middle office and other support functions)Contribute to client reporting and client meetings if requiredFirst point of contact for operational questions SAMCo advisory clients
What we need from you?
Masters degree, economics/econometrics with CFA or VBA qualificationHands-on team player with extensive experience in Portfolio Management (Fixed income and/or Equities, Hedge Funds)Strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills, in addition to the capacity to translate complex analysis into a concise investment caseStrong communication and interpersonal skillsExcellent verbal and written command of the English language; good presentation skillsEffective at building relationships and in influencing and negotiating in a challenging environment
An innovative place to work

There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.

An inclusive place to work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work

Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.



Disclaimer

Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description

Zendesk is looking for a highly experienced and motivated Commercial Sales Manager to continue growing our Commercial footprint within the Benelux. Zendesk's Manager for the Benelux will have full responsibility for leading their team to success!

We would love for you to play this key role in ensuring the achievement of our significant revenue growth targets in an incredibly fast-paced and dynamic market. You should have the energy, business insight, sales expertise and people management skills to build and inspire your team to consistently over achieve meaningful growth targets whilst working in close collaboration with our amazing cross-functional partners.

As an experienced Commercial Sales leader, you will develop and execute a multi-faceted Commercial sales strategy to increase our market share whilst building the highest levels of customer and team satisfaction. You will manage a team of highly driven, successful sales professionals, who are equally focussed on acquiring new logos and growing the revenue from their installed base.

Responsibilities
 Provide strong Commercial sales leadership, vision and direction for the sales team and broader Zendesk sales organisation Continue to hire, grow, lead and motivate your high-performing Commercial sales team Be accountable for the attainment of your sales representative’s assigned new customer acquisition and financial performance targets Track and analyse sales activities to understand and capitalise on buying trends and patterns in your target region Maintain a high level of knowledge of Zendesk solutions while staying current in understanding the competitive landscape and industry trends Be able to build relationships both internally and externally at the C-suite Establish policies, processes and procedures that will ensure revenue growth Roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary for the customer and your team
Requirements
 Demonstrable experience of managing high-performance teams with a minimum of 10 years sales experience, 5 of these would be in a Sales Management capacity Knowledge or a good understanding of the Commercial market within the Benelux, ideally in the Customer Experience domain Innovative and results-driven manager with strong SaaS/tech sales experience Consistent track record of success, driving revenue growth against quota and increased profitability Strong experience and understanding in a variety of sales methodologies and best practices Ability to be enthusiastic and creative in driving pipeline development Ability to provide accurate forecasting of pipeline development and management Entrepreneurial and focused with a passion to succeed Analytical and metrics-driven throughout all stages of the sales cycle
Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 150,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Description

Amazon Vendor Services (AVS) is a paid B2B service that aims to help strategic brands partner with Amazon.

Role

Collaborating with key retail functions such as Vendor Management, Supply chain management, Finance and Marketing, your role will focus on five crucial business areas

As a Brand Specialist in the AVS team, you will gain 360-degree exposure to all areas of e-commerce at a pan-EU level, owning the end-to-end relationship with your brand and advising your key account management partners as a business expert. You will define and implement taylor-made action plans to boost your brands’ performance, monitor success metrics on a daily basis, and ensure the brand’s experience of the AVS service is at the highest level.
 Business Advice: Identify opportunities based on deep data analysis and provide recommendations to improve sales and margin. Selection: Help grow selection by managing the launch of new products and improving discoverability. Availability: Drive supply-chain operational excellence by reducing costs, defects, lead times, and by managing stock in our fulfillment center. Traffic: Provide recommendations for the brand’s marketing and advertising campaigns to promote new products/increase traffic or conversion Conversion: Plan and implement promotional activities and improve the customer journey on Amazon through enhanced content on detail pages.
Could you embrace the challenge of being a Brand Specialist at Amazon? Join us and from day one you will grow professionally, developing a unique set of skills through continuous training and strong partnership with your team, peers and stakeholders across different functions. Being a brand specialist is the starting point to accelerating your professional growth within a global leader in e-commerce. Come build the future with us. We are constantly looking for Brand Specialists. If you want to begin your career with us, we have open roles starting in early 2021!


Basic Qualifications
 Bachelor’s/Master’s degree (Engineering, Business or similar field is preferred) Fluent written and verbal communication in English Dutch is a plus Minimum of 6 months professional experience in Marketing, Sales, Buying, Project Management, Supply Chain, or Consulting Knowledge in MS Office programs (Excel, PowerPoint…) Strong business acumen and analytical skills
If you are a enrolled student and are looking for open positions please review our openings for the Brand Specialist role and more here: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/business_categories/student-programs

Preferred Qualifications
 Experience in financial analysis, retail buying, retail planning & allocation, product/project management, marketing, business development, consulting, negotiation or supply chain is a plus Experience using analytical tools such as SQL
The location for this position is Amsterdam. There are also Brand Specialist roles in Madrid, Milan, Munich, Luxembourg, Istanbul, London and Paris.

Application And Assessment Process

Eligible candidates will be invited to attend an online assessment and successful candidates will be invited to an interview. This selection process is subject to change but you will be notified if any changes are made.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation or any other assistance, please let the recruiting team know and they will support you with the necessary actions throughout the interview process.

Who we Are Alter Domus is a global leader in providing fund and corporate services to the world’s most prominent private equity houses, real estate firms and private debt managers.With more than 15 years of experience and 40 offices and desks around the world, Alter Domus has left a true footprint in the financial industry and gained a global reach. Our commitment and dedication to our clients as well as our expertise and the quality of our services has enabled us to become a true partner of choice in the alternative investment industry.Since its inception in 2007, our Amsterdam Office offers our clients local expertise in law and finance from outstanding and highly-skilled professionals. This human-sized, yet dynamic office has allowed us to encourage a strong office culture and to significantly grow in both size and expertise. To pursue our ambitious growth development in the Netherlands, we are currently looking for a Junior Accounting Officer. Your Responsibilities:
As a junior Accounting Officer your will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of tasks including but not limited to: Assisting clients in implementing, incorporating and optimizing of holding, financing, and real estate companies and building and maintaining a strong relationship with clients;Handling day-to-day operations of companies and responding to client’s requests.Responsible for the bookkeeping of a number of companies;Responsible for the financial reporting including cash flow management;Preparing and coordinating of payments and related transaction monitoring;Preparing statutory financial statements and maintaining contact with auditors when applicable;Maintaining contacts with property managers, asset managers, tax advisors, lawyers etc.;(Assist with)preparing corporate and VAT returns and maintaining relevant contact with tax authorities and tax advisers;Taking part in restructuring plans or other transactions in compliance with recommendations of the local regulatory body, including spin- offs mergers and acquisitions. Your Profile:

About Dija

In 2021 customers should be able to get their groceries faster, receive exactly what they ordered, eat what they really desire, save money and reduce food waste.

Dija is on a mission to make this vision a reality.

Founded by former Deliveroo executives Alberto Menolascina and Yusuf Saban, Dija combines guaranteed stock availability, an innovative UI and ultra-fast delivery through our proprietary technology, liberating customers from the drag of supermarket shopping and unavailable delivery slots.

Dija is backed by top tier VCs, having raised one of Europe's largest seed rounds in history - $20 million.

Dija operates from hubs within the local communities we serve, helping us achieve our unique 10-minute delivery pledge. Our curated product selection and attention to local needs ensures we offer a full and compelling grocery experience.

Great journeys require exceptional people. Come to change grocery, stay for the team.

About The Role

Launchers are accountable for the expansion of the business. They have total responsibility for all aspects of taking a new site to market. This is a hugely varied role, favouring generalists who are adaptable and want to move quickly. Spending a lot of time in the field, Launchers will source and fit out new sites and coordinate with all parts of the business to take them to market.

Duties & Responsibilities
 Work with our Real Estate team to source and sign new sites. Execute the fit-out on time and on budget, constantly increasing efficiency. Work with internal stakeholders, such as Marketing, Tech, Operations and Merchandising, to launch fast and execute the go to market. Hire and onboard the site operations team. Contribute to the building of a playbook to be shared globally. 

Skills, Qualifications & Experience Required
 3+ years experience of working in a high-tempo environment in a related field. Self reliant with a strong bias to action. Highly organised with strong attention to detail. Clear communicator who enjoys working in a tight team. A growth mentality with a willingness to fail, quickly. 

Benefits
 Join one of the fastest scaling and high profile startups in Europe Shape your role and the company Experience a workplace that is entrepreneurial, fast-paced, solution-focused, disciplined, team-oriented and fun  Flexible working to support families and varying needs Competitive compensation package and generous stock options 20 days holiday + bank holidays Pension scheme  Company discount and free goodies  Regular team-wide events Cycle to work scheme (in progress)

ORGANIZATION
PurposeIn a world frequently driven by individual interests, FIFPRO is a not-for-profit organization that stands for equality and solidarity in professional football. With 65 affiliated national player associations across the world, they are committed to defending the employment conditions of footballers in what is often a short and fragile career.The world of work for professional footballers is shifting. Their global employment situation is more complex than ever. FIFPRO is committed to a player-centric working environment that protects them and shapes the future of the football industry. With their member unions, the organization has a proud track record of supporting male and female footballers marginalized through discrimination, unfair rules or workplace harassment. FIFPRO works behind-the-scenes but also supports high-profile legal cases such as those involving Jean-Marc Bosman (freedom of movement), women’s national teams (conditions) and Paolo Guerrero (anti-doping rules).As the only global representative of footballers, FIFPRO negotiates international rule changes with FIFA, leagues and clubs. These cover a broad range of subjects from the match calendar, to concussion protocol and the use of personal player data. With more players than ever working abroad, FIFPRO is more relevant than ever. 
OrganizationThe organization helps to coordinate support for players and make sure their voices are heard. To best serve them, the staff (30 FTE) are experts in subjects from sports law and footballer’s health to the personal development of players, for example through education. FIFPRO is a small and dynamic organization with a positive attitude. The headquarter is based in a modern and pleasant office in Hoofddorp. FIFPRO believes in teamwork and freedom to share ideas and start initiatives. Although the organization has decision makers, the goal is to make collective decisions. Colleagues of different expertise’s update each other in weekly stand-ups and project insight moments, and they celebrate successes together. Most importantly: the wellbeing of professional football players is at the heart of everything they do. Now we are looking for an experienced CFO to further strengthen and professionalize the organization for the further development. You and your team will work closely together with the legal, communication, policy and member services teams. 
POSITION
What are we looking for?We are looking for a Chief Financial Officer who has a proven track record in leading change in complex organizations. You are a strong stakeholder manager and able to create support for collective decisions in situations of different interests. Of course you have a strong financial background: knowledge of accounting and reporting (Dutch GAAP), controlling, business cases, investment decisions and risk management. You will lead a team of 4FTE and you are also responsible for fiscal and legal issues.Your main objective is to make sure all day to day tasks and responsibilities are in line with regulations and the organization strategy. You facilitate and enhance financial stewardship, transparency, compliance and performance. Besides your strong analytical and technical finance skills, the ideal candidate is change driven and shares the belief that the all decisions made should benefit the wellbeing of professional football players worldwide. We ask you to motivate, guide and develop the team and at the same time work just as hard to get everything done.You will be the reference point towards member associations, staff, but most important the Statutory Director and General Secretary. You will prepare all meetings with the shareholders and financial committee and will oversee and manage the annual audit and production of statutory accounts. Working closely with the auditors is of course part of this process.Apart of the primary process you take care of periodic reporting, fiscal issues, investment decisions, risk management and legal affairs. You are a sounding board for the Statutory Director and Secretary General. You position yourself next to the General Manager as a (strategic) business partner.
Main tasks & responsibilities:Leading the financial team ( 4 FTE);Overview of financial planning and budgeting;Annual accounts;Developing management reports;Formulating tax strategy (together with our tax advisors);Responsible for risk management (including legal constructions);Proactively identify and pursue opportunities for the improvement of all financial activities; Prepare and lead meetings for the STAK, Financial Committees and General Assembly;Participate and prepare meetings with the COO and our General Secretary;Support with financial advice in different projects organized within FIFPRO.
PROFILE CANDIDATE
The new CFO of FIFPRO has a track record as team player, with a high degree of professional ethics and integrity and an accurate understanding within an international organization dealing with a broad amount of different topics. You have a background as a CFO or Finance Director in a professional environment; Living in the Netherlands, fluent Dutch and strong communication skills in English (near native) are required. Next to this, we are looking for:
Completed Master’s degree in Economics/Business Administration or related education and/or post qualification (RA/RC); 10+ years of overall combined accounting and finance experience;Strong experience in an international dynamic environment, ideally experience within an international and multicultural (project) environment; Experience with the month-end/year end close process;Knowledge and understanding of fiscal and legal regulations;Sound judgement and ability to analyze situations and information; Knowledge and experience of real estate investments is a plus;You are a self-starting person who has impact based on expertise and a hands-on attitude leading to ‘every day’ improvement;Independent thinker, sharp analytical mind, fact based challenger; Strong but not dominant personality with good communication skills; Team player and ability to be a strong coach;Fluent in Dutch and English.
LOCATIE
Hoofddorp

The position Do you keep your eyes open above and below water and does state-of-the-art maritime technology fascinate you beyond measure? From deep under water to high in the air, at Van Oord you can indulge your dreams. Is that what you want? If so, apply for the role of Junior Surveyor at Van Oord!

At Van Oord, we build landmark maritime works which are often essential to ensure people's safety (and dry feet) and contribute to sustainable development. We love our work, but we don't love surprises. That's why your role as Surveyor is so important.

Are you a starting surveyor and looking for a job in which you receive further training and supervision for the position of surveyor? A job in which you are working on world-famous projects? Then read about what Van Oord has to offer you. For our projects, both in the Netherlands and international, we are hiring Junior Surveyors.

Your responsibilities You supply the project teams on site (from the Afsluitdijk in the Netherlands to the tropical Maldives or even off the coast of Taiwan) with topographic and hydrographic information, based on which important decisions are made. On a rotation basis and with a good work/ life balance, you provide the information required for the safe, responsible, sustainable and efficient execution of projects costing millions. Whether it's land reclamation, an offshore wind farm or the construction of a port, the project teams need to be able to trust your information implicitly. From setting up, maintaining and calibrating the advanced measurement equipment to analysing and incorporating the data into accurate and reliable maps, thanks to your efforts we will never be stumbling around in the dark. This is rightly regarded as a vital link and indeed a unique role, calling for your knowledge and ingenuity on and below the water.

Job Requirements
  a higher vocational or university degree in ocean technology, hydrography or similar;   at the most two years working experience as a surveyor;   a good command of English;   strong analytical and problem-solving skills;   a flexible attitude and willingness to work abroad for shorter or longer periods;   personal characteristics such as being resistant to stress, a result-driven attitude, a team player and enterprising.  

We offer We will give you the responsibility and freedom to successfully contribute to completing innovative and prestigious projects in a challenging international work environment. We also offer an excellent benefits package tailored to your background and experience. The package includes among other things
  a salary that matches your responsibilities and experience;   32 leave days of which a max. of 7 days can be appointed as collective leave days;   a pension scheme;   a variable bonus;   extensive learning and (personal) development possibilities;   an adequate travel allowance;   collective health insurance (optional);   flexible working hours.  

Over Van Oord Van Oord is a leading global contractor in dredging, hydraulic engineering and offshore projects (oil, gas and wind). We are an innovative partner for our clients and have been contributing to the infrastructure of tomorrow's world for over a hundred years. Our people are committed, enterprising professionals with a passion for water and technology.

Controller - Real Estate
Ben jij een medior controller binnen de real estate sector?Sta jij open voor groei en lange termijn?About Our Client
Voor onze klant zijn wij op zoek naar een controller. Onze klant is een Nederlandse beursgenoteerde kantorenbelegger. Zij zorgen ervoor dat hun klanten in staat zijn om maximale productiviteit en groei te bereiken. Dit doen zij door het bieden van de beste service en de meest flexibele vastgoedoplossingen in moderne, gezonde en duurzame kantoren op toplocaties. Hun portefeuille bestaat uit 63 gebouwen met een waarde van meer dan 1,3 miljard euro.

Job Description

In deze rol ben jij verantwoordelijk voor een adequaat en professioneel georganiseerde financiële administratie (crediteuren-, debiteuren- en servicekostenadministratie, grootboek) en projectadministratie en periodieke rapportages. Als controller draag je op een adequate, proactieve en professionele wijze bij aan de kwaliteit van de financiële informatievoorziening. Je werkt mee aan periodieke financiële afsluitingen, je ontwikkelt managementinformatie en operationele rapportages en standaardiseert voor deze business. Teven draagt zorg voor de operationele uitrol en faciliteert beschikbaarheid van de informatie (tijdig, juist volledig). Je rapporteert in deze functie direct aan de Senior Business Controller De overige omschrijvingen zijn:

About PVH Corp.

PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world.

We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good.

Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric intimates brand. True&Co. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.

About Tommy Hilfiger

Tommy Hilfiger, which was acquired by PVH Corp. in 2010, is a global apparel and retail company with more than 16,000 associates worldwide. With the support of strong global consumer recognition, Tommy Hilfiger has built an extensive distribution network in over 90 countries and more than 1,400 retail stores throughout North America, Europe, Latin America and the Asia Pacific region. Global retail sales of the Tommy Hilfiger brand were $9.2 billion in 2019

Founded in 1985, Tommy Hilfiger delivers premium styling, quality and value to consumers worldwide with a brand portfolio that includes TOMMY HILFIGER and TOMMY JEANS.

Tommy Hilfiger is one of the world’s most recognized premium designer lifestyle groups and is recognized for celebrating the essence of “classic American cool” style, featuring preppy with a twist designs.

Its focus is designing and marketing high-quality men’s tailored clothing and sportswear, women’s collection apparel and sportswear, kidswear, denim collections, underwear (including robes, sleepwear and loungewear), footwear and accessories. Through select licensees, Tommy Hilfiger offers complementary lifestyle products such as eyewear, watches, fragrance, swimwear, socks, small leather goods, home goods and luggage.

The Team
The Buying Operations team is responsible for managing the global Tommy Hilfiger purchase orders. This team works in close collaboration with the Buying and Planning teams, Sourcing teams, Vendors and inbound teams.

The Position
Ensuring correct and timely Purchase order placement and confirming agreed delivery datesMonitor Purchase orders status through different Systems and Tools, SAP, Infor Nexus and VMS, follow up to ensure on Time Delivery and Arrival and inform stakeholders as requiredPo Maintenance related to On Time Delivery dates, mode of transport, delay reasons etc in SAP Maintaining close relationships with vendors and global sourcing Hubs to understand PO status and specific Vendor and Country of origin challenges and opportunitiesAssessing impact of over- and under shipment and negotiating discounts or re-production with vendors or sourcing hubsMonitoring, reporting and able to explain KPI’s statusMaintaining good working relationship with internal up and downstream teams, Planning and Buying team, Inbound team, Order fulfilment team

The Ideal Candidate
Education: HBO / University degree or equivalent in Business, supply chain, Logistics.Minimum 1 year of relevant working experience in a fast-moving international environmentExperience in Fashion industry and/or Supply Chain is an advantageProficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint), Advanced Excel skills requiredAnalytical and result orientated mind-setHigh level of accuracy and problem-solving skillsComfortable working under pressure with deadlinesProactive, supportive, and hands-on mentalityExcellent communication skills in English

What You Can Expect From Us
A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities 

Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to know why this is THE role for you!

PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Due to ongoing delivery success and ambitious growth plans, Turner & Townsend is looking for a suitably qualified and experienced Associate Director to join our Real Estate team in the Netherlands. This is a key strategic role for the business, combining business generation and project delivery with a focus on the local Dutch education market. The successful candidate must be Dutch speaking and have an extensive network and experience managing large scale, complex projects within universities, schools and education facilities.

You will be self-motivated, driven by the goal of establishing Turner & Townsend as the #1 consultancy for real estate construction projects in the Netherlands.

You will be fee earning, acting as Project Director for key projects and/or programmes, with particular involvement during initiation / set-up, establishing the project execution plans and master programmes / schedules.

However, as Associate Director you will also increasingly be responsible for developing and delivering on a business plan for >20% annual growth, working closely with the Netherlands Board to align sector ambition with business operations.

Qualifications
You have at least Bachelor’s degree in Built Environment, Construction Management or other relevant discipline.Minimum of 15 years of experience in project management of real estate projects.Established network in the education sector in the Netherlands.Excellent track record winning work and building teams.Good written and reporting skills.Fluent Dutch and English language skills are required for this role.

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance. 

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

Are you a media expert who enjoys devising multi-channel plans and collaborating with a wide range of teams? Know how to execute effective ATL campaigns? Then we're looking for you!

Our story (the bitesize version)

Whether it's brunch in Barcelona or lunch in Lisbon, millions of food-lovers order delicious dishes with us every day. Here at Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're now active in 24 countries worldwide, with more than 200,000 restaurants on our roster.
As a growing global business, our media strategy and buying need to be highly effective. That's the aim of our Media Managers, who deliver multi-channel magic across key regions.

All About The Role

As our Media Manager: Southern Europe, you lead a team responsible for media strategy and above-the-line (ATL) buying across three key markets – Italy, Spain and Portugal. Your business expertise will help us overcome challenges, identify innovative ways to attract consumers and drive effective media strategies for all three countries.

Collaboration is a vital ingredient in your role. That includes working closely with the Country Marketing team to understand local issues and opportunities and translating their needs into coherent briefs. You'll also work closely with colleagues in the Digital team to devise multi-channel plans.

In This Wide-ranging Role, Your Focus Also Includes
Handling the day-to-day planning and execution of ATL campaigns in your portfolio of countriesOwning specific budget lines for your markets and overseeing the performance of key metrics such as reach & frequencyLiaise with the Media agency for your markets, showing enthusiasm for our business and challenging them on their strategic thinking, planning & executionGetting involved in commercial negotiations with media vendors, alongside the Media agencyWorking closely with our award-winning Brand team to ensure that campaigns have the right media mix to engage with customers in Italy, Spain and PortugalAlign with the Digital Media and Sponsorship teams to develop effective strategies for all channels & with the Insights team to track market trends and customer behaviourKeep track of the latest media trends and articulate valuable opportunities to the wider marketing community. Colleagues will look to you for clear insights & guidance

Can you deliver…

Ready to be our expert media manager? Here is what we need from you:
At least 5 years' experience in media roles, either in-house or with an agencyBachelor's Degree or higher, preferably in Marketing or a related fieldA track record of managing high-budget media campaigns, as a client or agency side. That involves every aspect of the process (strategy, planning, buying, reporting)Genuine media expertise, with an in-depth understanding of the media landscape and key levers, especially relating to TVFluent English (written & spoken) as well as Italian and/or SpanishStrong negotiation skills, and previous experience with striking successful business dealsAble to take a helicopter view, stepping back from the details & thinking strategically about how media can impact our key business metricsExcellent communication skills, adapting your style to fit the relevant audienceAn analytical, detailed and performance-focused approach to your job

Here is our offer

Like the perfect food pairing, your skills and these great rewards belong together:
Competitive salaryAn impactful Media Manager role, with scope across three key markets: Italy, Spain and Portugal26 days of holiday per yearA vibrant & creative work environment in London or Amsterdam (when you're in the office)Competitive pension planBudget for internal & external training and conferencesMonthly working from home allowanceAdditional perks – these vary between the U.K. and the Netherlands

Spice up your career as our Media Manager: Southern Europe. Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

Job Title: Head of Franchise Development, Choice Hotels Europe
Job Description:
A key member of the Choice Hotels Europe leadership team, the primary role for the Head of Franchise Development is the delivery of portfolio enhancements and accelerated earnings growth through leadership and execution of the Europe strategic growth plan.

In order to maximize franchise property growth this position will require strong industry relationships and be able to represent Choice Hotels to the International development community. The individual will be able to ensure continued, sustainable and dynamic growth in both bringing on additional hotel properties, but also in seeking out new development opportunities.

Primary Duties And Accountabilities

Strategic Leadership
Set the strategic direction and provide coaching and guidance to the teamWork with the Europe’s Leadership team and Choice Hotels International Division to establish the company’s long term growth strategy and annual business plan goals and tacticsEngage in organic and strategic strategies to identify prospective franchisees, and proactively follow up on new franchise expansion opportunities in a manner consistent with Choice Hotels Europe strategy.Implement strategies to secure franchisees within the targeted markets identified for growth.Consult with prospective franchisees on the benefits of joining the Choice system and the steps involved in becoming a Choice Hotels Europe franchise owner.Prepare proposal information for submission in respect of the development of new-build or conversion Choice Hotel properties as well as re-licenses and brand re-positionings.Perform related duties and/or responsibilities as required or assigned.
Effective Management
Direct implementation and ongoing refinement of the teams’ action plans to achieve long term and milestone goalsBuild brand awareness through the correct presentation and representation of Choice Hotels brandsBuild strong franchise relationships that increase franchise retention and growth.
Talent Management 
Maintain high performance levels by developing clear and measurable accountabilities, motivating associates, provide development opportunities and address performance issues promptly and consistentlyHire, retain and continually develop diverse, high caliber talent who are able to make strong positive impact on the organization. Anticipate future talent-based business needs.
Stakeholder Relations 
Develop strong connections with franchisees to positively impact franchisee satisfactionPrepare and share performance and industry reports with multiple stakeholders.

Skills, Educational Background & Experience

The ideal candidate will bring the following skills, experiences and attributes:
Post-secondary education with degree or diploma in a related field or combination of education and experience.10 years’ experience in hotel industry, business brokerage, franchising, commercial real estate brokerage or combination thereof.Excellent communication and relationship development skills, using a high degree of tact, skill and diplomacy.Highly self-motivated with a strong sense of urgency.Demonstrated success in B2B sales of significant dollar amounts and/or long-term contract terms.Excellent negotiating skills with the ability to influence and liaise with related business community.Excellent organizational skills; highest level of integrity.Strong self-management skills with demonstrated ability to work independently.Innovative in his/her approach, the successful candidate will be open to new ways of doing things and will also contribute new suggestions as to how to augment/build on Choice’s success to date.
Ability to model Choice’s Cultural Values: Welcome and Respect Everyone, Be Bold, Be Quick, Listen, Be Curious and Show Integrity.

Job Title: Account Manager/New Business Development - Fast Moving Consumer Goods
Job Description:
Company Description

Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market.

We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.

Job Description

Your goal as the Account Manager for fast-moving consumer goods at Wish is to develop our growing 1st and 3rd party business, using data-driven analysis to bring optimal supply that delivers results, through understanding our Wish platform and the needs of our customers.

A successful Account Manager will be able to effectively identify growth opportunities and work with external partners and internal stakeholders to remove barriers and find solutions to grow.

The ideal candidate is passionate about Wish and e-commerce growth at scale, has a strong innate curiosity, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

 What you'll be doing 
Build & grow key fast-moving consumer goods brands, via 1st and 3rd party relationshipsProcess 1st-party purchase orders, catalogue creation & shipping plans, in timely manner Evaluate supplier quotes and key benchmarks Support Senior Buyer in day to day administrative tasksProactively manage technical and operational hurdles in new merchant on-boardingEffectively communicate & collaborate with relevant internal stakeholdersDemonstrate analytical thinking and leverage data to drive decision makingYou'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in the Netherlands."

Qualifications
Minimum 1-2 years job experience (CPG experience essential); exceptional recent college graduates will be consideredKnowledge of the fast-moving consumer goods and online shopping industry, particularly with marketplaces & marketplace sellersPrevious experience in a similar role strongly desired (Buying, Account Management, Sales, Marketing) Highly competitive, smart, detail-oriented, relentlessly resourcefulStrong personal presence with excellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, & proficiency in CRM systemsTeam-oriented but has the ability to work independentlyAgile individual with the ability to work autonomously in a demanding and ambiguous environmentMust be fluent in Dutch and English

Additional Information

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Individuals applying for positions at Wish, including California residents, can see our privacy policy here.

Waarom wil jij als Vastgoed Adviseur aan het werk?
Als vastgoed adviseur houd je je bezig met vraagstukken voor het beheer van gebouwen. Van overheid gerelateerde gebouwen tot commercieel vastgoed. De werkzaamheden die worden verricht zijn bijvoorbeeld het uitvoeren van Technische Due Diligence onderzoeken. Je komt in deze functie te werken in het team Vastgoedadvies, die onderdeel uitmaken van de Afdeling Vastgoed. Deze afdeling bestaat uit circa 30 professionals. Deze professionals zijn verdeeld over de vestigingen Midden- en Noord-Nederland.
Wat ga jij doen als Vastgoed Adviseur?
Uitvoerden van Technische Due Diligence onderzoeken;Opstellen en actualiseren van meerjaren-onderhoudsplannen (MJOP);Inspecties uitvoeren conform NEN 2767 en de RGdBOEI-methodiek;Opstellen van onderhoudscontracten en deze controleren;Voorbereiden van contract onderhoud;Begeleiden van plantmatig onderhoud, groot onderhoud, renovatie en verbouwingen.
Wat bieden wij jou als Vastgoed Adviseur?
Een uitdagende fulltime functie van 40 uur;Een uitstekend salaris tussen de € 3.500 en € 4.000 (o.b.v. 40u/pw.), afhankelijk van jouw opleiding en ervaring;Een aantrekkelijk pakket aan secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;Mogelijkheid tot zowel interne als externe scholing en vele doorgroeimogelijkheden;Afwisseling tussen buiten en binnen en af en toe langere afstanden afleggen.
Wat vragen wij van jou?
Je beschikt over hbo opleiding richting Bouwkunde;Enkele jaren relevante werkervaring en affiniteit met de bouw;Je beschikt over een commerciële instelling en je stelt de klant centraal;Communicatief vaardig, ondernemend en ambitieus.

The Opportunity
FastSpring's Mission is to empower its employees to build the world's leading ecommerce platform and deliver the highest customer success level. We are an innovative company with the best of both worlds; a profitable global company with thousands of customers worldwide, an entrepreneurial culture, and a growth mindset.
We are committed to building an inclusive work environment and we invest in our employees by helping team members grow and develop professionally. FastSpring employees are encouraged to attend events and share what they do. We are developers, technologists, and business professionals who are globally-minded, customer-focused, and driven to innovate.
The Position
FastSpring is currently seeking a skilled, self-motivated, and energetic Account Executive with a proven track record of sales success, to be responsible for an individual annual revenue quota. The Account Executive will be responsible for applying an understanding of FastSpring’s e-commerce solution, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques, and customer base while selling our solution. We’re looking for a dynamic team-player to work closely with potential clients, the FastSpring sales team, and several internal operational groups to accelerate the sales process.
This position is required to work out of FastSpring's Amsterdam office. Responsibilities
Thoroughly understand customer needs and effectively communicate the FastSpring solution value propositionIdentify and remove typical buying objections in prospect discussionsProspect, identify, develop, negotiate, and, ultimately, close new customersDevelop and manage pipeline to meet or exceed quarterly lead and sales quotasIdentify and prioritize sales opportunities through direct prospecting, lead follow up and networkingClosely manage the sales process from qualifying to closing and implementationTimely follow up and qualification of new prospects from either inbound leads or customer requests generated by marketingProvide high-level demonstrations of FastSpring products via video conferenceMaintain accurate and up-to-date forecastsProvide feedback to the marketing and product teamsManage and maintain accurate leads, opportunities, and account information within Salesforce.com
The right candidate must be self-motivated, proficient, and capable of grasping the numerous facets of digital e-commerce technology. The qualified individual would ideally have the following:
Skills and Experience
Confident, clear, and dynamic communicator. Strong written and verbal skills requiredSelf-starter capable of staying focused in a challenging, high-pressure sales environmentStrong selling, influence, and negotiation skills to set up qualified appointmentsUnderstanding of marketing and customer acquisition processesAbility to manage time effectively and work independentlyWorking knowledge of web technologies and digital e-commerceSkilled at negotiating business termsExperience working in a start-up environment or ability to work in a rapidly expanding and changing environmentGrowth mindset, willing to grow and learn from others, and receive and quickly assimilate ongoing feedback with a drive towards excellence
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, marketing, or business preferred3+ years of on-quota sales experience; Salesforce, SaaS, and marketing automation sales experience a plusProficient with Salesforce.com to track and manage tasks, manage opportunities, and maintain up-to-date customer records on a daily basisProficient with G Suite and online business toolsA history of selling total solution automation
About the Company
FastSpring is the trusted ecommerce partner for companies that sell software around the world. With FastSpring’s full-service ecommerce solution, you can sell more, compete big, and stay lean. Founded in 2005, FastSpring is a privately owned company headquartered in Santa Barbara with offices in Nebraska, Amsterdam, and Halifax. For more information, please visit https://www.fastspring.com.
FastSpring is an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION employer. Candidates are considered for employment with FastSpring without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, veteran status (specifically status as a disabled veteran, special disabled veteran, Vietnam Era veteran, recently separated veteran, armed forces service medal veteran, or other protected veteran) or other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

HR Business Partner, dit is je uitdagingBouwinvest, gevestigd in Amsterdam, is een van de grootste institutionele vastgoedbeleggers van Nederland. Met betrokken en toekomstgerichte medewerkers zetten zij in op "real value for life", waarbij naast financieel rendement ook maatschappelijk rendement nagestreefd wordt. Het vermogensbeheer draagt bij aan een duurzame, leefbare, toegankelijke stedelijke omgeving en het verbeteren van pensioenuitkeringen. 
De organisatie is aan het groeien en is bezig met een professionalisering van de interne organisatie. In de rol van HR business partner ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de ondersteuning bij deze verandering door het adviseren en begeleiden van directie en management op alle HR gebieden. Als HR Business Partner weet je welke kant Bouwinvest op beweegt en wat dit betekent voor HR en je eigen HR-portfolio. Je kent methodieken waarmee je de rol en positie van HR in de organisatie bepaalt en welke stappen je moet zetten om met succes de rol van HR Business Partner te vervullen.
Ben jij een ervaren all-round HR Business Partner? Met ervaring in de financiële sector en wil je opleiding & ontwikkeling een boost geven? Ben je daarnaast assertief, integer en je staat stevig in je schoenen? Wil jij de uitdaging aan gaan bij deze mensgerichte en veranderende organisatie? Lees dan snel verder! 
Als HR Business Partner heb je de volgende verantwoordelijkheden:Fungeren als sparringpartner en regisseur voor directieleden en het management en leveren van een aantoonbare bijdrage aan de organisatiestrategie en -resultaten van Bouwinvest;reguliere werkzaamheden verrichten zoals; werving & selectie, verzuimbegeleiding, regie voeren over PFB cyclus (planning, functionering en beoordeling), strategische personeelsplanning, succession planning en opleiding & ontwikkeling;deelnemen aan HR projecten op onderwerpen als instroom/doorstroom, beloningsbeleid, performancemanagement, organisatieontwikkeling en opleiding & ontwikkeling;ondersteunen van de organisatie in het opbouwen van leiderschap binnen Bouwinvest;gezamenlijk optrekken bij het verwerken van nieuwe wetgeving;coördineren, verbeteren en implementeren van verbeterde processen in lijn met de organisatie cultuur, structuur en visie.
Als HR Business Partner rapporteer je aan de Head of Human Resources & Facility Management.
De uitdaging ga je aan bij BouwinvestBouwinvest Real Estate Investors investeert vermogen van institutionele beleggers in vastgoed. De organisatie heeft ruime ervaring in de vastgoed- en pensioenwereld. Zij begrijpen de behoeften van de klanten en spelen in op de continu veranderende markten. Ze beleggen voor de lange termijn en beheren circa €13 miljard in de diverse vastgoedsectoren zoals in residentieel, retail, office, hotel en healthcare. Naast Nederland is Bouwinvest internationaal actief in o.a. Europa, Noord-Amerika en Azië. Onlangs zijn er kantoren geopend in Sydney en New York.
De organisatie bestaat ruim 65 jaar en bij Bouwinvest werken ruim 200 professionals en groeit gestaag. Daarnaast is Bouwinvest bezig met een professionaliseringslag voor de interne organisatie (integrated risk). Maatschappelijke verantwoordelijkheid en transparantie zijn belangrijke strategische punten. 
Als HR Business Partner versterk je het HR team, bestaande uit vier andere collega’s, waaronder een collega HR Business Partner en twee HR administrateurs allen onder leiding van de Head of Human Resources & Facility Management. Als HR Business Partner ben je een enthousiaste en betrokken gesprekspartner, organisatiesensitief, geeft advies en weet iemand te overtuigen. Jouw zelfstandigheid, creativiteit en passie voor opleiding & ontwikkeling voegen veel toe aan Bouwinvest. Tevens ben je op de hoogte van de trends en ontwikkelingen in je vakgebied en past deze toe.
Natuurlijk wil je ook weten hoe het is om bij Bouwinvest te werken. De cultuur wordt gekenmerkt door de “purpose” en “community”. De verbinding bij Bouwinvest is heel groot; informeel, open en benaderbaar. Het beste uit jezelf naar boven halen en samen in een goede werksfeer resultaten behalen typeert Bouwinvest.
Jouw werkplek is goed te bereiken met het openbaar vervoer. Vanaf bijvoorbeeld Amsterdam, Utrecht en Den Haag zijn er goede verbindingen naar station Sloterdijk. Vanaf het station is het slechts 2 minuten lopen. Daarnaast is er ook parkeergelegenheid op eigen terrein. 
De vacature biedt meer dan alleen een uitdaging:Een marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;goede secundaire voorwaarden, waaronder een eindejaarsuitkering, variabele beloning, uitstekende pensioenregeling, reiskostenvergoeding, 25 of meer vakantiedagen (afhankelijk van leeftijd) en 13 ATV dagen, laptop, telefoon en thans een Corona thuiswerkvergoeding;een uitdagende functie in een dynamische, professionele en groeiende organisatie;ontwikkeling staat binnen Bouwinvest centraal met volop mogelijkheden voor opleiding en trainingen;een gezonde werk-privé balans;modern kantoor (naast station Sloterdijk) met flexplekken, mooi bedrijfsrestaurant en goede koffie en thee. Daarnaast zijn er alle faciliteiten om goed te kunnen werken, zowel thuis als op kantoor. Dit breng jij voor de vacature HR Business Partner mee:Een afgeronde hbo- of wo opleiding, bij voorkeur op het gebied van HRM;7 tot 10 jaar relevante werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie in de profitsector en bij voorkeur in de financiële sector;uitstekende beheersing van zowel de Engelse als Nederlandse taal;grote affiniteit en aantoonbare ervaring op het gebied van het ontwikkelen en opleiden van medewerkers en duurzame inzetbaarheid;bij voorkeur 40 uur per week beschikbaar, vanaf 32 uur is bespreekbaar;tot slot ben je zelfsturend, analytisch, je hebt uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden en je bent een selfstarter.
Solliciteren naar de vacature HR Business Partner?Dat kan! Als jouw profiel naadloos aansluit op de vacatureomschrijving, ontvangen we graag je cv en korte motivatie. Upload deze nu meteen via de site. Je kan er op rekenen dat je binnen vijf werkdagen een eerste reactie op je sollicitatie ontvangt.
Nieuw bij Rvdb? Wanneer je solliciteert maken wij direct een account voor je aan in RAY. Een platform waarin jij centraal staat. Hierin wordt nog makkelijker om een fantastische baan te vinden doordat bijvoorbeeld alle hr vacatures van Nederland verzameld zijn.
Let op: Vanwege de nieuwe privacy wetgeving is het belangrijk dat jij jezelf registreert voor RAY. Je gaat dan akkoord met onze privacy statement. Cv's en motivaties via de mail kunnen wij niet in behandeling nemen.
Rvdb ondersteunt Bouwinvest exclusief in deze procedure. Dit betekent dat reacties van andere bureaus niet op prijs worden gesteld door onze opdrachtgever. Je kan ons rechtstreeks benaderen voor al jouw vragen. Wij staan in de startblokken om je verder te helpen.
Nog vragen?Onze collega’s Leonie Riksen (06-24492188) en Sandra van der Zijpp (06-27028665) nemen de tijd om antwoord te geven.

Your challenge

The Companys Clinical Nutrition Business Unit Is Embarking On An Ambitious Transformation Of Its Go-to-market Strategy Composed Of 3 Main Elements
Clinical Nutrition has a diverse portfolio with new product launches and a rich pipeline. The offer has evolved from providing essential drugs to supportive medical device and digital service offering. You will support the team transition from cost-based to value-based selling and from product sales to integrated product-service offering sales.We aim to expand our service from hospital to home, accompanying the patient across the extended continuum of care. You will work closely with the homecare manager to develop a solid sales playbook for the team. Looking for what works and reiterating it, you will provide continuous resources and coaching to the team.The covid situation has accelerated the digital transformation. Providing a seamless experience between both the digital and physical customer interactions will be key. You will play an important role as change agent, mentor and strategic gatekeeper to ensure the sales team have the right mindset, skills, and supporting tools to achieve the required sales transformation and capture the benefits from digitalization.

Role Responsibilities
You are invested in coaching, training, and empowering the sales team while acting as a role model and supporting the companys values.
Team management: You ensure your team is going to the right direction, targeting the right opportunity and customers by utilizing market insights and customer data for prioritization. You constantly look for ways to improve the sales force efficiency while implementing tools to manage its performance.Customized individual coaching: You dedicate time for team and individual meeting/checkpoints to coach and help salespeople develop and reach their targets.Data driven analysis: You track both indicators of past results and leading indicators with potential impacts on future results. You are forecasting revenue, projecting pipeline growth, and calculating key metrics. You are pivotal in overseeing the team to ensure that high quality customer and sales data is consistently entered into the systems.You own the budgetary and planning processes and monitor performance against budget, taking appropriate action to address any variances.As agent of change, you are incorporating in your daily routines activities to promote regional change initiatives, coordinate active knowledge sharing between sales and product/service delivery to surface new improvement ideas and facilitate joint problem solving.You understand and drive the team to embrace omnichannel strategies and support the team in optimizing the digital interactions with the customers. You work closely with the local and regional marketing team to bring the appropriate tool and activity to support the sales team come to a close leveraging both digital and physical customer interactions.You co-operate closely with Marketing, Sales Support and Customer Service in order to reach full customer satisfaction & the set targets. You own customer issues and ensure all parties and team members are kept informed to enhance customer loyalty.You build collaborative partnerships with key internal stakeholders such as Technical Services, IT, Operations to support solutions that require cross-department collaboration in both sales and delivery.

Skills And Experience
Seasoned Sales Manager experience (3-5 years experience leading a team) with product launch experience and a demonstrated record of driving value-based selling. Evidence of achieving targets and getting results.A great communicator with customer orientation and strong interpersonal skillsExperience in identifying the buying and decision-making process, successfully bringing the sales cycle to a close in both analog and digital setting.Passion for shaping digital interactions using a variety of tools and techniques going beyond zoom calls and webinars.Proven ability to translate team targets into individual action plans in a timely manner.Demonstrated role model and coaching expertise in daily and deal-specific situations in both analog and digital setting.Prospecting, relationship building, negotiation and closing skills. Passion for exploring, locating and proposing new business deals and commercial models. Identifies barriers to change and addresses these appropriately.Ability to easily switch between keeping a holistic overview of market dynamics and detailed troubleshooting when required.Good knowledge of healthcare and medical devices commercial landscape and competition; Continuously looks for business intelligence and competitive information.Good knowledge of country healthcare structures, national healthcare politics, and hospital financing.Works autonomously, self-starter; learns quickly.Fluent in English and Dutch.

Wil je met jouw financiële analyses bepalend zijn in het succes van Ballast Nedam Development?
Jouw uitdagingIn jouw rol als Controller adviseer en ondersteun jij het management van Ballast Nedam Development voor wat betreft de financiële beheersing in de breedste zin van het woord. Bij Ballast Nedam Development houden wij ons bezig met het investeren in en het ontwikkelen en bouwen van aantrekkelijke woon-, werk- en leefomgevingen in binnenstedelijke gebieden.
Je kunt een brede en afwisselende functie verwachten, omdat het een combinatierol tussen financial, business en project control is. Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen van business cases voor nieuwe acquisities, waarbij je ook markt- en locatieonderzoeken doet en je met zowel interne als externe stakeholders schakelt. Jouw bevindingen presenteer je aan het management met daarbij een sterk onderbouwd advies waarom wij dit project moeten aangaan of juist niet. De verdeling van jouw werkzaamheden is afhankelijk van de gestelde prioriteiten, maar de nadruk zal liggen op het bepalen van de projectinvesteringen.
Het team waar je in terecht komt is relatief jong en bestaat uit 4 personen. Je rapporteert direct aan de Head of Finance, maar je hebt ook korte lijntjes met de CIO. De business unit zelf telt zo’n 35 man, waarbij je ook veel te maken hebt met internationale collega’s. Kortom: een rol met veel afwisseling, uitdaging en zelfstandigheid!
Ben je ambitieus en wil je je binnen enkele jaren ontwikkelen tot een ervaren Controller? Solliciteer dan vandaag nog!
Jouw werkzaamhedenBusiness control: investeringsanalyses, fiscale optimalisatie, probleemoplossing, managementrapportages, onderhouden en optimaliseren van interne controles, automatisering/ICT en cash flow forecasting;Binnen business control focus gebied investeringsanalyses: financiële- en vastgoedanalyses middels financiële ratio's (IRR, Cash on Cash, ROE, etc.) en marktgegevens;Project control van ontwikkelprojecten: analyse en rapportage van budgetten, beheersen van de actuals en verplichtingen, opstellen van prognoses, cash flow van projecten en adviseren van projectontwikkelaars;Financial control: jaarverslagen, periodieke rapportages en consolidatie.
Jouw profielJe hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding, bijvoorbeeld in de richting van Bedrijfseconomie of Real Estate;Je hebt ervaring in een soortgelijke rol, zoals Controller, Consultant Real Estate of Finance Analist Vastgoed;Je hebt ervaring met financiële modellen en bent vergevorderd met Excel;Je hebt een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift;Je bent sterk analytisch, communicatief vaardig en bent in staat om alle benodigde gegevens te verzamelen.
Ons aanbodEen complexe en uitdagende werkomgeving in een groeiende internationale organisatie, met ruimte voor persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling;13x een marktconform salaris per 4 weken, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;30 vakantiedagen;Individueel budget van 6%: deze kan je laten uitbetalen of extra dagen van kopen;Een laptop en telefoon.
Ballast Nedam DevelopmentBallast Nedam Development ontwikkelt aantrekkelijke woon-, werk- en leefomgevingen in binnenstedelijke gebieden. Plaatsen waar mensen graag willen zijn én waar ze zich prettig voelen. In elk project zijn wij ons bewust van de impact die we hebben. Op de directe leefomgeving, op de wereld én op de toekomst. Wij zijn een Nederlandse projectontwikkelaar met een internationale oriëntatie. Onze projecten zijn grensverleggend, zo houden wij een voorsprong op de toekomst. Ballast Nedam Development is onderdeel van het wereldwijd opererende Renaissance en is dochteronderneming van Ballast Nedam. Via hen hebben we alle mogelijke expertise en ervaring in huis. Dat maakt ons naast creatief en innovatief, ook slagvaardig en realistisch. 
Wij kijken uit naar jouw reactie!Interesse in deze uitdaging? We ontvangen graag je sollicitatie! Vragen over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met Stephanie Grasmaijer, Corporate Recruiter, via stephanie.grasmaijer@ballast-nedam.nl.
Acquisitie door werving en selectie-, detacheringsbureaus of andere bemiddelingsbureaus naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Kandidaten die zonder overleg worden voorgesteld als Controller zullen niet in behandeling worden genomen.

Functieomschrijving
Ben jij klaar met je studie richting Vastgoed of Bouwkunde, maar ben je nog lang niet uitgeleerd? Heb jij een brede interesse in vastgoed en alle disciplines die daarbij komen kijken? Ben je nieuwsgierig én leergierig ingesteld en wil je werken binnen een inspirerende omgeving waar je omringt wordt door ervaring?

Als Trainee Vastgoed kom jij te werken binnen een organisatie waar een goede balans is tussen young professionals en experts in het vastgoed. De ideale setting om jouw carrière van start te gaan dus! Je komt terecht in een warm bad waar persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei voorop staan. Er wordt op alle mogelijke manier gezorgd dat jij met de juiste bagage op pad kunt. Zo wordt je gekoppeld aan een deskundige collega die jouw wegwijs maakt in het vakgebied. Dit is jouw mentor; hij leidt jou op middels een ‘training on the job’ en hij heeft antwoord op al jouw vragen. Daag hem vooral uit met de moeilijkste vragen, des te meer dat jij te weten komt!

Daarnaast wordt er ook middels trainingen en cursussen geïnvesteerd om jou ‘up and running’ te krijgen. Je kunt hierbij denken aan een EPA-W/U, post-HBO, en de BENG. Middels deze weg wordt jouw rugzak aan kennis en ervaring gevuld zodat jij na een gedegen inwerkperiode vol vertrouwen het werkveld in kunt!
Functie eisen
Wij zoeken iemand met een afgeronde HBO richting Vastgoed, Bouwkunde of Werktuigbouwkunde heeft en een brede interesse in de vastgoedmarkt. Je wilt jezelf ontwikkelen en je bent in het bezit van een autorijbewijs B.

Herken jij jezelf in de volgende profielschets?
 Je bent enthousiast en weet van aanpakken; Je ben klantgericht; Je bent commercieel en hebt goede sociale vaardigheden; Je stelt je flexibel op en je kunt zaken zelfstandig oppakken.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Verder Kun Je Het Volgende Verwachten

Wanneer je gaat werken bij dit bureau krijg je naast een goed, marktconform salaris veel interne en externe trainingen.
 De mogelijkheid om jouw uren flexibel in te delen zowel thuis als op kantoor; Een bedrijf waar veel mogelijk is, als het komt vanuit intrinsieke motivatie!
Het betreft een vacature waarbij het de bedoeling is dat je de vaste kern van het bedrijf komt versterken. Wij weten alles over deze vacature en het bedrijf. Wij zorgen ervoor dat je goed voorbereid de sollicitatieprocedure in gaat. Welke vragen zijn handig om te stellen? Welke dresscode hanteren ze? Welke vragen kan ik zelf verwachten? Wij weten het allemaal en helpen je om alles uit het gesprek te halen.
Info over het bedrijf
Deze organisatie is gevestigd in Eindhoven. Onze opdrachtgever die het niet uitmaakt of je een ervaren professional of een jong talent bent, en op welke positie je speelt. Zij geloven er in dat wanneer je doet wat je leuk vindt, je het maximale uit jezelf kunt halen. Zij bedienen een breed spectrum van MKB bedrijven tot grote internationale bedrijven. Zij werken voor opdrachtgevers door het gehele land. Bij deze partijen worden zij ingehuurd voor hun bouwkundige en installatietechnische expertise. Het is een organisatie die zich kenmerkt door de goede balans tussen ervaring en young professionals, het is een prettige omgeving om je verder te ontwikkelen.

VP Corporate Development EMEA
Vice President, Corporate Development EMEA

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 220+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 71+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Summary

Leads EMEA Corporate Development Team and is responsible for all deal activities related to mergers and acquisitions, real estate investments, and strategic investments. Works closely with the executive team, and relevant functions to ensure timely execution of our M&A, real estate investments, and capital planning projects.

Responsibilities

Investment Management & Optimization
Sets direction and strategy for IBX development pipeline, managing and prioritizing regional capex budget and approving planned capacity additions Sets metro real estate strategies and optimizes IBX development plans within metro, leading Design & Construction, Sales, Ops, Finance and other teams to improve regional performance and executionOversees all regional real estate transactions, including land acquisition, building acquisitions, lease renewals, and new leasesResponsible for management of tenant lease portfolioResponsible for underwriting and seeking management and board approval for capital expansionsRepresents investment proposals to executive management at global investment committeesGuides ad hoc financial analysis and support investment analysis across functionsOversees budget and forecasts for regional capex investments

Mergers & Acquisitions
Establishes and leads M&A strategy for the regionSources and analyzes accretive acquisition and partnership opportunities for the regionEstablishes expectations and leads cross-functional teams through sourcing, evaluating, and buying/selling processesDrives development of operational models and synergy forecasts for targetsLeads negotiations (with support from the legal team) for M&A transactionsRepresents and drives deal approvals at the Senior Exec and Board Level

Strategic Planning & Development
Leads annual strategic planning process in conjunction with Regional and Corp teamsApproves strategy/business case development and sponsors at Exec LevelNegotiates at Exec level to obtain buy-in for Cross-functional projectsProvides vision and input into research on market extension opportunities 

What We Are Looking For
Proven ability to see the ‘bigger long-term picture’ and think strategically while achieving short-term resultsAbility to determine and present clear strategic direction for inorganic and organic dealsInspirational leader with strong collaboration skills and proven ability to work cross-functionally with diverse business unit leadersDemonstrated ability to communicate effectively and persuasivelyAbility to work with senior executives, driving proposals through consensus, to fruition.Proactive, collaborative, and able to work comfortably in a non-hierarchical context.


Additional Requirements
15+ years demonstrated track record in general management, investment banking, corporate developmentSubstantial track record of M&A and real estate closing experience and business partnership experienceSignificant experience over a broad range of sizes (<$10M and >$500 M)Knowledge of the retail data center business, and data center business regionally and globally, or large Technology, Telecoms, or Cloud and Platform solutions.BA/BS degree or equivalent experience requiredMBA preferred
