Description

About Nielsen, division Pointlogic

Nielsen, division Pointlogic helps customers with decision making in the area of media and marketing. Our main assets are Nielsen data and advanced analytics capabilities. Nielsen’s office from Rotterdam has a data science team of about 25 people with backgrounds in econometrics / operations research / mathematics.

We offer data science / econometrics / operations research / mathematics students the possibility to either work solely on writing their thesis project (part of their MSc curriculum), on internal projects, or on a combination of both.

About

You can always discuss with the hiring managers about the topics you are interested in, or you can request a more updated topics list during the interview

If you are interested in writing your thesis with us, we invite you to look at some of our past topics.

 Accelerated probabilistic programming
Pointlogic uses probabilistic programming extensively for performing various types of analytical inference; currently that inference is performed in Stan. Probabilistic programming is a tool for statistical modeling, closely linked to performing Bayesian Statistics - it seeks to describe probabilistic models and then perform inference in those models.

One of our current technical challenges is that our models are computationally expensive and we do not have satisfactory options for reducing the run time. The goal of this project is to evaluate the various algorithms and technical frameworks available for performing probabilistic programming.

We have a few potential avenues that we would like to explore but are open to other ideas as well:
We currently use Hamiltonian Monte Carlo, another option is to use Variational inference – which gives approximate answers but in a more timely fashion. Evaluating new frameworks for Pointlogic specific models. Recent frameworks include; Edward (which uses Google’s TensorFlow as a backend) & Pyro from Uber AI labs. Use of GPUs for large matrix calculations or exploring distributional computing through systems such as MPI. General reparameterizations to the model structure that allow for more efficient sampling. 

flex-12

 Modelling advertising effectiveness under uncertainty
The goal of this project is to review a current component of modelling using survey data at Pointlogic. Our respondent level brand health models almost

We Have Many Potential Areas For Exploration Here
Currently the Contact Estimation & Modelling are two separate procedures – would there be added value in having a single procedure that performs the operation concurrently? Is using the expectation of number of contact sufficient or is there enough added value in incorporating more of the uncertainty around the number of contacts to justify the added complexity and computational overhead? Is there a bias in estimated effects of media by channel after Contact Estimation? If so, how large is it and can we construct a methodology to correct for any bias? 

flex-12

 Machine learning for dimension reduction
In many projects, Pointlogic uses dimension reduction in order to reduce the number of features used in a model. The most common technique used is principal components. In this project, we will use machine-learning methods (e.g. auto-encoders) to do dimension reduction and compare the performance with commonly used methods.

For Media Measurement (panel) Integration, The Following Example Of a 1-1 Fusion Is Illustrative

Data fusion is a method of integrating data sets using statistical analytics and modeling in order to create a single data set that incorporates the attributes from both underlying sources. The ‘integrated’ dataset allows us to make analysis that require variables from both sides.

Data Set 1: TV panel. This is a data set of television viewing for a group of people. This data set includes demographics (e.g. age, gender, ethnicity, people in the home, income), along with detailed television viewing behavior, and information about computer device ownership and usage behavior. We will let the TV panel be the recipient data set. Data Set 2: Radio panel. This is a data set of listening behavior for a separate group of panelists (not in Data set 1). This data set also includes demographics, some measurement of TV and most importantly detailed listening behavior. Let the radio panel be the donor data set. Data Set 3: The fused data set. The integrated data set that has the original panelists from the TV panel but these panelists have been assigned listening behaviors that came from the radio panel
To create Data Set 3, we identify like-variables within both Data Set 1 and Data Set 2, which are called linking variables. Using statistical analysis to understand how each of these variables correlates to both viewing of television and listening behavior, we establish importance weights for each variable, including which variables must match exactly between both data sets (always age/gender and various demographics traits).

When the linking variables and their importance are established, we can define a distance function between respondents. The next step, linking donors to recipients while minimizing distances is known in Operations Research as a generalized assignment problem and it is well studied. Standard algorithms can solve the assignment problem very efficiently. The combined dataset can be used to estimate the overlap between TV stations and radio stations, or the joined reach of a cross-media campaign.

flex-12

Outlier detection in TV panels
In many countries, Nielsen is responsible for providing TV ratings data: information on how many people watched specific shows on television. These TV ratings are considered a ‘currency’ as advertisers buying spots for TV advertising pay based on the amount of people watching during that time. Therefore having robust, reliable ratings is crucial for Nielsen and the TV buying market. TV ratings are measured via a panel study; the size of this panel varies by country.

 The aim of this project is to identify individuals that demonstrate not natural viewing behavior with the use of sophisticated indicators that should be set.  Specifically the task is to define a scientific methodology and tools to detect suspicious individuals. Based on this set objective indicators to conclude about proved

Considerations to be taken into account: instructions given to individuals by third parties to watch something could be not constant in time and could be different for different channels, could be quite sophisticated aiming not to be revealed in easy way.

The aim is to explore opportunities of machine learning capabilities and various statistical methods. Available information is viewing data for each individual by each channel and listing of demographic characteristics on daily base. Viewing data is available on viewing statements level. Analysis should be performed along whole period of panel existence with regular periodicity in order to detect false behavior individuals in-time manner upon their appearing. The moment when household is disclosed and contacted by third parties with instruction to watch something in specific is not known, it could be in the beginning of household inclusion into the panel or any day during the whole period of presence in the panel.

flex-12

 Opportunity for a thesis project in the area of Operations Research with Nielsen 
Nielsen Planning products support advertisers and agencies with planning advertising campaigns. Based on the vast datasets that Nielsen collects, we can make estimates of the reach of cross-media campaigns that cover digital, linear TV, radio etc.

To help clients, our products have optimization capabilities. For instance, to determine the best budget split across media such as YouTube, Facebook, TV networks and thousands other media. In this project we will seek to minimize the advertiser's spend given a required % of reach among the audience. For instance, how to reach 80% of potential buyers of a new car with the least budget possible. This a continuous optimization problem with a linear objective function but with a non-linear constraint. The reach function is also relatively slow to evaluate, as it crunches to a very large dataset.

flex-12

 Wisdom of the crowd
 Surveys about media consumption behavior are the core of many of our products  . The biggest and most time-consuming part for respondents are questions related to the reach and frequency of specific media channels. Due to the large amount of channels, we are forced to ask respondents only about a subset of channels. Experiments show that we are able to collect much more/accurate information when asking people to assess group behavior rather than individual behavior.

The goal of this project is to combine two interviewing techniques, which will allow respondents to describe their media behavior in a non-traditional way. 
 The first experimental treatment introduces previously collected data about media consumption, and will ask the respondent to make corrections to match this consumption with their own consumption.   The second treatment includes questions that ask respondents about the average media consumption of their peer group rather than themselves. 
By doing so we can assess respondents’ meta-knowledge about the population distribution rather than their own and correct for individual errors. This project includes combining these two treatments in a two by two experimental design and comparing the results with data collected by our traditional questionnaire design.

 Note: this project requires primary data collection and funding, these considerations can be done only after submitting a complete research proposal. 

flex-12

Your profile
Currently enrolled in a Master in Computer science, Econometrics, Mathematics, or other quantitative MSc; Some experience in R and/or Python programming, classification models and theory of simulation; Good command in spoken and written English; Available for at least 32 hours per week; Available for a period of at least 6 months; Residing in the Netherlands. 
If you are interested in a thesis internship, feel free to apply. We would like to find out if you are up for this challenge, so please include your CV, motivation letter and grades list. 

flex-12

Job Title: (Senior) Financial Services Accountant - Real Estate & Private Equity
Job Description:
Are you fit for the future and do you add to change?

Vistra Netherlands has a new, truly client centric model which focuses on client engagement and satisfaction, as well as commercial success. We offer a robust and seamless service delivery model, supported by centres of operational excellence (enabled by efficient and automated processes).

To be able to respond to new requests from our existing clients as well as new parties, we change the way we work. Large companies expect a sparring partner at a certain level, who knows the regulations well and can advise on what a client should look out for. Our client portfolio requires more in-depth knowledge to comply with these demands.

As Senior Financial Services Accountant Real Estate and Private Equity, you use your in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge to perform sector specific accounting activities. your designated clients will (mostly) be real estate, international private equity and venture capital firms, or their portfolio companies. Together with the other accountants on the team, you provide the best service to your client portfolio in terms of ensuring the integrity of accounting records, providing customised interim reports, assisting on complex client transactions and coordinating the VAT and CIT calculations with the Tax advisor. As Senior Accountant in the team, you work independently, are open to leading projects and act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

You will also be working in close collaboration with the SSC team in India to jointly manage PropCos with RE located in The Netherlands.

There will be a lot of interaction with Property Managers, Asset Managers and Auditors.

You will act as a central point and deal with various topics such as VAT returns, CIT returns, DAC6 reporting, quarterly/monthly accounting & reporting, RE transactions, RETT, Cash Management, Consolidation, Financial Statements and externa audits.

The Netherlands team acts as the binding force between various parties involved such as lawyers, notary, tax advisors, Dutch Tax Authority, Dutch Central Bank and more.

So, if you would like to deploy your accounting expertise to a renewed organization in a challenging market, then Vistra Netherlands has an interesting opportunity for you! We are open for a strong Senior Financial Services Accountant Real Estate & Private Equity, who will contribute to make Vistra's services fit for the future! 

Key Responsibilities

As Senior Financial Services Accountant Real Estate and Private Equity, you commit to our clients, you'll be working as ONE, you do the right thing and you empower people.

You are responsible for performing sector specific accounting activities.

 You act as a personal mentor and resource for colleagues with less experience; You have a client facing role since you act as an intermediary between Vistra's Shared Service Center and the client; You ensure the integrity of accounting records for completeness, accuracy and compliance with accepted accounting standards; You produce client customised interim reports, Investor reporting and Waterfall calculations for the clients; You assist on complex client transactions and manage these in the accounting system; You coordinate the (Dutch) VAT & CIT calculations with or without theTax advisor; You work independently with minimal guidance and are open to leading projects independently; You interact with internal peers such as client facing teams, legal and compliance, and project teams but also with i.e. vendors, clients and regulators; You act as deputy for your supervisor in periods of absence.

Desired Skills and Experience
At least BSc degree in Finance (for example in Accounting, HEAO Business Economics, SPD) or Master Specialization in Finance (for example in Business Economics, Business Administration, Accountancy or Fiscal economics) At least 3 years of accounting experience, preferably in Real Administration;  Specific experience in: Dutch GAAP (expert level), preparation of financial statements and consolidations, computerized accounting packages; Preferably experienced with Yardi, and Millogic; Excellent knowledge of Dutch taxes (for example VAT, CIT, DWHT, RETT); Excellent command of the Dutch and English language, verbal and written; You have a keen eye for detail, you are persuasive, strong in communication and focused on results of the team. When dealing with executives of reputable (international) companies / firms, are able to stand your ground and have the ability to build and maintain solid relationships.

Description

GroupM is the number one media investment group worldwide. We always find and create the right audience for our (global) clients, connecting them to the brand as effectively and efficiently as possible. Moreover, we have all the tools and knowledge to realize the desired marketing outcomes. GroupM in The Netherlands consists of digital agency Greenhouse and the media agencies Wavemaker, Mindshare, and Mediacom. Our clients include Netflix, Mars, Unilever, Volvo, FrieslandCampina and many more. GroupM is part of WPP.

Thanks to the freedom and responsibility you get from day one, GroupM is a place where ambitious young professionals are able to show what they are capable of.

What does the job entail - What does your day look like?

The programmatic team in Amsterdam is part of the Video and Display Crafts, that consist of digital specialists across Amsterdam, Eindhoven and Sittard. The team is working for Xaxis and Greenhouse, on clients of our three media agencies. As a Programmatic Specialist, you will work for the biggest brands in The Netherlands. You will get your own set of clients for which you are responsible. You advise clients on YouTube, programmatic video, audio, display and/or native solutions, and you develop integrated programmatic media plans. Further, you manage (international) campaigns and optimize these towards your main KPI. The data-geek in you enjoys analyzing data, in order to take your campaigns to the next level. You’ll be using the most advanced advertising technology in the market, including an internally developed AI optimization tool, a DMP and several dashboards. Afterwards, you draw clear conclusions and share your recommendations with the client in a professional manner. You are also co-responsible for developing and promoting innovative solutions in the field of programmatic within GroupM, Greenhouse, the media agencies, and our clients. You can think of things such as CTV, artificial intelligence (AI), advertising in and around gaming, cookieless planning, or interactive and dynamic creatives. So, there is plenty of challenge for everyone!

What do we expect from you?

Service
You are responsible for developing integrated programmatic media plans on a tactical level. Your plans could include different YouTube formats, multiple programmatic video formats, programmatic audio, display or native.You advise our clients and media agencies on programmatic solutions, based on their KPI. You proactively propose new formats and innovations.You are the first point of contact for our media agency for all substantive and operational questions on your own clients.You are responsible for a smooth process during the campaign and for customer satisfaction.You are responsible for the guidance of one or multiple Campaign Managers.With your DSP and platform knowledge, you optimize your campaigns towards the best possible results and ensure you achieve the campaigns' objectives.You convert trends from the market and needs from the media agency into proposals, taking into account learnings from previous campaigns.You work on projects and innovations that help us to be the frontrunner in the industry.
What does the team look like?

The team of 30 digital specialists in Amsterdam consists of Strategists, Team Leads, Specialists, Campaign Managers, and the Tech, Supply, and Data Lead. The Programmatic Specialist works in an agency team; either the Wavemaker, Mindshare or MediaCom team. The agency team consists of Campaign Managers, Specialists, a Team Lead and a Strategist. The Programmatic Specialists report hierarchically to the Team Lead.

What do we offer you?
We offer a great challenge with good growth opportunities in a state-of-the-art and inspiring work environment.You get the freedom to develop yourself in specific areas of your interest, for instance in automation, AI, interactive/dynamic creatives, brand safety, CTV and many more.A lot of attention is paid to coaching and training, because we care about your personal and professional development. You have access to many different trainings and workshops on our own GroupM University, as well as trainings from external partners (such as Google, Xandr, Amazon, VIA).An impressive client portfolio with some of the biggest brands in the world.A large international network from GroupM and WPP.The position comes with an attractive salary and good fringe benefits.
What are the requirements?
Minimum of 2 years work experience in online advertising or ad tech.Experience with programmatic buying.Operational programmatic DSP (e.g. DV360, Xandr, Amazon) knowledge is required. Additional platform knowledge (DMP, Google Ads) is a pre.Good command of English is required.HBO or WO education level.We’re looking for a team player and an initiator; someone who is result-oriented, customer-focused, quality-oriented, and persuasive.Familiarity with the services of media agencies.
This sounds like my job!

We would like to invite you to apply to this job. Click on the 'apply' button at the bottom of this vacancy and send us your resume and motivation in Dutch or English. If you are the person who can help us to realize our ambitions, we would like to get to know you! We will call you for a first introduction and/or invite you for an interview through Microsoft Teams.

WPP (GroupM) is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual, and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity - it's about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique, and that's what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces differences and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Founded in 1920, Eastman is a global specialty materials company that produces a broad range of products found in items people use every day. With the purpose of enhancing the quality of life in a material way, Eastman works with customers to deliver innovative products and solutions while maintaining a commitment to safety and sustainability. The company's innovation-driven growth model takes advantage of world-class technology platforms, deep customer engagement, and differentiated application development to grow its leading positions in attractive end-markets such as transportation, building and construction, and consumables. As a globally inclusive and diverse company, Eastman employs approximately 14,500 people around the world and serves customers in more than 100 countries. The company had 2020 revenues of approximately $8.5 billion and is headquartered in Kingsport, Tennessee, USA. For more information, visit .

Job Description

The Business Developpment Manager (BDM) will be responsible for Adhesives Business Development efforts throughout the region with a focus on new applications driving MDI, new market penetration, and new customer acquisition and value chain extension (i.e. Brands). Job Title: Volunteer: Wildlife + Travel Photography in South Africa
Job Description:
Posted by
    








            Jeremy Freedman
 

            Founder of Foxman Frames & Global Nomadic
          
 







        Send InMail






Location: Mossel Bay, South Africa

Duration: 1-2 months

Start Dates: Start dates are each month, enquire with us when applying.

Cost: $3,000 USD per month.

Fee Includes: all food, accommodation, airport pickup, pre-departure + in-country support, orientation and all project related activities

Does not Include: flights, travel insurance, personal spending, visas and vaccinations

Please note: This opportunity is designed to give you the contacts and experience to help further your career. You are not replacing any member of staff, but helping alongside them, whilst learning new skills.

Benefits
 Gain hands-on experience working with an environmental and media company in South Africa Ideal for interns with an interest in developing their wildlife and travel photography and career Keywords: travel expeditions, travel photography, wildlife photography, how to succeed as a young photographer, media career, 
The project you will be working with is an environmental and media company who focus on bringing attention to environmental issues specific to Africa, always looking for unique and authentic perspectives in their work. They work with many different clients, ranging from broadcasters, corporations, non-governmental organizations, print media and online news outlets. Their work is not restricted to land-based work, and you can also get wet with their underwater photography component!

Professionalise your career aspirations and learn how to make money from photography, whilst experiencing incredible photographic platforms in Africa. This course has evolved over the past 6 years to provide you with exactly what you need to break into the competitive world of photography. During this month, you will accompany our photographers throughout the Garden Route and receive expert guidance on how to produce artistic and quality photographs on wildlife and travel. On occasion you may also have the opportunity to participate in professional shoots for clients, producing marketing material for advertising and social media campaigns, enabling you to gain professional experience working with paying clients.

We have also included tutorials and practical training on setting up your own business; specifically how to ensure you can make enough money to startup and maintain your business; how to write a basic business plan and most importantly how to market yourself and build your income streams. Practical training is key and so the trainers dont just talk at you.They offer you practical experience and guide you, step by step through the process. They have a busy alumni program that will assist you to open the necessary profiles in the media industry to get you off to a flying start. This training, coupled with the practical experience of shooting within various wildlife and travel platforms, will enhance your career prospects. Some benefit from credits within their schools or colleges, where applicable.

Daily Life

On this project you will receive tuition in both basic and more advanced stills photography and in software: lightroom and to a far lesser extent, photoshop and other applications. You will attend in the field trips (see below) with our staff. We enjoy a good relationship with various environmental organisations along the Garden Route and this offers a once in a lifetime opportunity to participate, not only in learning how to survive and make money in todays markets but also how to prepare for a shoot and work professionally in the field/ on location. Daily work will be split between tutorials and practical work in the field.

In addition to your training, you will get to go on various expeditions which include;
 5 day / 4 night trip to the Great Karoo to incredible private Mount Camdeboo private reserve and you may also get to view the scenic private reserves of Asante Sana and Samara on this fantastic trip 2 day / 1 night trip to Plettenberg Bay where we visit Jukani wildlife park, Birds of Eden and Monkeyland and spend a few hours at Tenikwa sanctuary 1 x trip to shoot local people: a project in conjunction with local organisations 1 x day trip to the Robinson pass, Cango Wildlife Ranch and the dramatic waterfalls of the Swartberg mountains ( not possible every month as is weather dependent) 1 x cage dive with local cage diving boat White Shark Africa (typically included, but not guaranteed due to weather) 2 x trips to shoot surfers/body boarders and/or skate boarders 1 or 2 x UW pool shooting trip to a heated pool but, if weather allows we do a rock pool shoot too hiking morning with shoot of caves and slow shutter speeds of waves on the world famous St Blaize Trail 1 x night shoot from any of the above locations- star trails or Moon rise sunsets and sunrises techniques for landscapes and travel photography 1 x half day trip to the Valley of Desolation in Graaff-Reinet in the Great Karoo to shoot the sunset and, when time permits, an hour trip around the National Park. 
Please note: all information above is subject to change. Please check the most up to date information on the Global Nomadic website when applying.

Job Title: Head of Subscriber Acquisition, EMEA - HBO Max
Job Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a talented Head of Subscriber Acquisition to execute on the D2C user acquisition strategy of paying subscribers for HBO in Europe (paid and organic). Reporting to the Head of Growth Marketing for EMEA, you will supervise all the teams responsible for organic and paid subscriber acquisition in EMEA, the social media team (organic) and the recently created digital creative services team. You will also be responsible for the efficiency of the subscriber acquisition (acquisition costs).
We are looking for a full stack growth executive, with an overall experience and understanding of the acquisition funnel and the whole lifecycle of the different acquisition channels. Your key focus is ultimately to drive the acquisition of new subscribers to HBO Europe’s services by using a blend of analytical thinking, data driven experimentation and learning, automation, knowledge of the latest marketing tools, together with behavioural and creative marketing.
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of Data, Product/Tech, Content, Automation, and Marketing.
This position can be based in London, Amsterdam or Copenhagen.
What you’ll be doing:Lead, inspire and coach the Subscriber Acquisition team, with all the acquisition channels and our creative services teamDrive customer acquisition volume through the different traction channels (organic and paid)Manage and evaluate performance of all marketing campaigns, assess against business goals (ROI and KPIs), and constantly optimise performanceWork closely with Finance and BI teams on forecasting and budgetingManage budgets across regions and channels and optimise towards LTV in each channel and regionManage all relationships with external marketing agencies and other partnersWork closely with the team on cross funnel optimization and campaign planningCreating business cases and implementing improvements that need product/tech resources such as updating of Sign-up funnel, implementation of payment solutions, landing page improvements etc. Analysing and executing price and promotions changesResponsible for a wider team across all 19 MarketsDecision making responsibility for all performance marketing activities and campaigns activated by the team and marketing agencyKey relationships and reporting lines:Within the Growth team: Brand Marketing, PR, CRM, Commercial Strategy and Business DevelopmentOther teams: Management, Finance, Business Intelligence, Programming, Product, and the equivalent teams in Latam and USMain external: Marketing agencies, Google and Facebook, media partners
What we’re looking for:Experience leading direct to consumer growth marketing strategies. In addition, experience in media and subscription would be a plusProven skills and success running user acquisition and managing international multi-disciplinary teamsExperience with online ad service concepts, video, mobile and socialExperience from programmatic buying working with both DMP and DSPCapacity to collaborate with different areas involved in the growth initiatives (Product/Tech, Marketing, local teams, BI, data scientists, creative, content)Deep understanding of digital marketing analytics, tracking program performance, and testing resultsPreferably having professional experience from working with Google and FacebookExperience in managing the relationship with digital media buying agenciesDomain expertise in UI/UX best practicesAdvanced understanding of overall cross-platform attributionExcellent data analysis skills, analytical mind, and a curious/entrepreneurial mindsetAbility to collaborate with international marketing colleagues to craft optimal marketing programs that reflect regional market opportunities, languages, and customer preferencesHigh standards of excellence and attention to detail, and at the same time capacity to manage – in a collaborative way -deadlines and pressure on complex, international, large-scale, time-critical projectsExcellent interpersonal skills, entrepreneurial mindset, and a resilient spiritLove for films, series, and HBO content is a great plusFluent in written and spoken EnglishBachelor or Masters, in Marketing, Economics or a quantitative discipline, or other similar training
Many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including flexible hours or an element of working remotely. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need.

Job Title: Assistant Professor Water and Climate Information Services
Job Description:
We are looking for

an emerging scholar in the field of Water and Climate Information Services. You have a PhD degree, and you are trained in scientific research in the field of water and climate using combinations of natural, social and governance sciences. You have some experience in doing field studies.

You will contribute to the research line “Adaptive Planning and Design” of the Water Systems and Global Change group (WSG). In this research line, we analyze, assess and design climate adaptation strategies and plans for water systems at multiple scales. Our current research covers long term planning under uncertainty (e.g. adaptation turning points, adaptation pathways), innovations in coastal management (e.g. nature-based, multifunctional flood defenses), monitoring and analysis of real-life experiments (e.g. climate proofing of catchments) and development of hydro-meteorological information services.

As our new colleague you will strengthen the expertise of our team. Your focus will be on water and climate information services in an international context. You will build upon our research on integrating scientifically generated water and climate services with local information user’s knowledge and co-creation of forecasts information and information service interfaces. In your research and teaching you will use and add to the approaches currently used at WSG, including large-scale modeling approaches. You will take a multi-disciplinary approach actively seeking collaboration with scientists from other fields both within our group as well as other groups within the WUR and other international institutions.

You will also be dedicated to acquire funding from a mix of government, EU and private sources and publish regularly in leading international academic journals. You will be supported in developing an individual research grant application to either the Dutch Innovational Research Incentives Scheme (VENI-VIDI-VICI) and/or the European Research Council.
T
eaching is an important task of tenure track professors. You will have a meaningful role in the strongly internationally oriented teaching programs. You will supervise MSc and PhD students. Moreover, you assist with existing courses taught by the WSG in, primarily, the MSc program International Land and Water Management. Over the long term, opportunities will emerge to develop your own courses and co-design MSc and BSc programs at the University.

The successful candidate will proceed through the tenure track system at Wageningen University. Within a period of 12 years after being appointed as Assistant Professor, you could reach the level of Professor in your own field. You will, therefore, establish an internationally visible independent research profile and identify where your research makes a societal impact.

We ask
A PhD degree in a domain that is relevant for climate & water information servicesExperience in combining natural sciences, social sciences and water governanceInterest in the relation between water systems and global change in an international contextExperience and affinity with delivering high quality education at BSc and/or MSc levels, including supervising BSc and MSc students.Experience in acquiring and leading internationally oriented research projectsExperience with and/or interest in transdisciplinary research and field studiesAn emerging publishing record in peer reviewed international academic literature.A standout colleague and a team-player, willing to contribute to the wider interests of the team and the university.Excellent English communication and writing skills

We offer

An exciting position. Evaluation on job performance is every 3/4 years, and a positive outcome will lead to a permanent position after 7 years. Depending on your experience, a competitive gross salary from a minimum of € 3746,- to a maximum of € 5127,- (assistant professor position) and from € 5190,- to a maximum of € 6317,- (associate professor position) for a full working week of 38 hours in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement Dutch Universities (scale 11 and scale 13).

In Addition We Offer

You will enter a career trajectory called Tenure Track, with an excellent environment for you to grow, excel and work within the department to make a difference in our field. Successful evaluation will allow growing towards a Professor holding a Personal Chair. This includes the chance to define your own research line and research group. We offer training and mentoring, as well as opportunities to work part-time.
8% holiday allowance;a structural year-end bonus of 8.3%;excellent training opportunities and secondary employment conditions;flexible working hours and holidays can possibly be determined in consultation so that an efficient balance between work and private life is possible;excellent pension plan through ABP;232 vacation hours, the option to purchase extra and good supplementary leave schemes;a flexible working time: the possibility to work 2 hours per week extra and thereby to build up extra leave;a choice model to put together part of your employment conditions yourself, such as a bicycle plan;a lively workplace where you can easily make contacts and where many activities are organized on the Wageningen Campus. A place where education, research and business are represented;use the sports facilities on campus We stimulate internal career opportunities and mobility with an internal recruitment policy. There are ample opportunities for own initiative in a learning environment.
We offer a versatile job in a cosmopolitan environment with varied activities in a pleasant and open working atmosphere.

Coming from abroad
We are the #1 university and research centre for life sciences. The themes we deal with are relevant to everyone around the world and Wageningen, therefore, has a large international community and a lot to offer to international employees. Applicants from abroad moving to the Netherlands may qualify for a special tax relief , known as the 30% ruling. Our team of advisors on Dutch immigration procedures will help you with the visa application procedures for yourself and, if applicable, for your family.
Feeling welcome also has everything to do with being well informed. Wageningen University & Research's International Community page contains practical information about what we can do to support international employees and students coming to Wageningen. Furthermore, we can assist you with any additional advice and information about helping your partner to find a job, housing, schooling, and other issues.

More information

Would you like to know more about this vacancy? We will be more than happy to provide you with further information. Please contact: Prof. Carolien Kroeze, tel:+31 (0)317 484870; e-mail address: carolien.kroeze@wur.nl or Prof. Fulco Ludwig, tel:+31 (0)317 486443; e-mail address: fulco.ludwig@wur.nl

For more information about the procedure, you can contact Edgar Tijhuis, corporate recruiter, edgar.tijhuis@wur.nl

Address your application, including a cover letter with your motivation and a CV, to the chair of the Search Committee for this position, Prof Carolien Kroeze. Please upload your application online via the apply button on this page before 30 March 2021. Do not upload other documents than explicitly asked for.

Equal opportunities
WUR employs a large number of people with very different backgrounds and qualities, who encourage and motivate each other. We want every talent to feel at home in our organisation and be offered the same career opportunities. We therefore especially welcome applications from people who are underrepresented at WUR. For more information please go to our inclusivity webpage. A good example of how WUR deals with inclusiveness can be read on the page working at WUR with a functional impairment.

We are

The goal of Wageningen University & Research is to deliver a substantial contribution to the quality of life. We search for answers to issues affecting society- such as sustainable food production, climate change and alternative energy. In Wageningen, we encompass the entire chain of knowledge, from fundamental research to science-based and up-scalable practical knowledge to create solutions that have impact. A coordinated approach to problems and the cooperation between various disciplines are at the heart of the outstanding approach of Wageningen.

Every day 6,500 people work on 'the quality of life', turning ideas into reality, on a global scale. Could you be one of these people? We give you the space you need!

The Water Systems and Global Change (WSG) group is a solution oriented multidisciplinary research group where staff and students can develop new skills and excel in their science. In our research, we analyze and assess the impacts of climate change and population growth on water systems and propose and test adaptation strategies. We use simulation models, earth system observations, scenario analysis and field studies. We actively invite students from different backgrounds, and skills and interests to take part in our courses and research. Also our staff comes from a diverse range of backgrounds. Currently our group has 15 staff members, 7 post-docs and more than 30 PhD students. The group currently has as an excellent funding base with lots of external grants and projects from a broad range of funding organizations. Research of the group has a strong international focus, with projects at global scale as well as a strong focus on Africa and Asia.

Our teaching focusses on contribution to three different Master Programs: International Land and Water Management, Climate Studies and Environmental Sciences. Within these programs we provide a range of Master courses related to Global change impacts on water resources and climate change impacts and adaptations. In addition, we teach in a number of BSc minor courses. A growing number of students is interested in the work of our group and last year we had about 70 MSc students doing their Master thesis at our group.

Als vastgoedspecialist werk je aan projecten waar gronden nodig zijn, zowel tijdelijk als definitief voor de uitvoering van onze projecten. Daarnaast begeleid je verkooptrajecten van gronden die niet meer nodig zijn voor de doelen van ProRail. ProRail werkt jaarlijks aan zo’n 150 projecten waar grondverwerving doorgaans op het kritieke pad van realisatie ligt. Minnelijke aankoop, maar ook onteigening en de begeleiding van deze procedures komt daarbij voor. Jij bent in staat dit proces zowel inhoudelijk als procesmatig alleen en samen met anderen te begeleiden en je te begeven in een projectgestuurde omgeving. Compliancy en efficiency zijn hierbij leidend. Je beschikt over kennis en ervaring bij waardebepalingen en overige componenten van schadeloosstellingen. Je hebt ervaring met het aansturen van rentmeesters die alleen of samen met jou onderhandelingen voeren met rechthebbenden. Je hebt oog voor politieke verhoudingen en weet resultaatgericht te blijven.

Jij bent iemand die goed bestand is tegen druk en je kunt verplaatsen in de ander. Je gebruikt jouw kennis en expertise om de juiste beslissingen te nemen en te overtuigen. Je werkt mee aan verbeteringen voor het team en geeft jouw input daarin. Je verbreedt en verdiept je kennis en deelt dat met je collega’s. In je werk zoek je draagvlak en ziet hoe je via verschillende wegen je doel kunt bereiken. Daarnaast denk je mee bij het beleid ten aanzien van het beheer van de gehele grondportefeuille.

Met je resultaatgerichte en collegiale houding versterk je het team en draag je bij aan de strategische doelen (verbindt, verbetert, verduurzaamt). Je bent actief in het opbouwen, beheren en handhaven van het relatienetwerk benodigd voor jouw functie en voor de Afdeling Vastgoed. Daarbij profileer je je actief binnen ProRail en bij (externe) stakeholders, draag je het beleid van de afdeling Vastgoed uit en bent ambassadeur voor de afdeling Vastgoed en ProRail.

Kortom: Jij bent de specialist die om kan gaan met diverse belangen en je kunt verplaatsen in de ander. Je bent een gewaardeerde collega die zijn/haar kennis graag deelt en werkt aan een inhoudelijke en procesmatige invulling van je werkzaamheden. Je kijkt verder dan het project en denkt mee aan verbeteringen voor het team. Je bent analytisch, hebt een groot anticiperend vermogen, creëert automatisch draagvlak en hebt ervaring met het werken in projecten.

Overtuigd? Solliciteer!

ProRail wil een organisatie zijn die ruimte biedt aan iedereen. Talent als basis, diversiteit als kracht om betere resultaten te behalen.
Bij ProRail vinden wij het belangrijk dat jij gewoon jezelf kan zijn. Daarom zijn wij benieuwd naar wie jij bent!

Solliciteer uiterlijk op zondag 4 april 2021 en laat ons weten hoe jij binnen ProRail verder verbindt, verbetert en verduurzaamt. Toch eerst nog een vraag? Stel hem gerust aan recruiter Roos Bleijenburg via roos.bleijenburg@prorail.nl. Voor inhoudelijke vragen kun je contact opnemen met de manager afdeling Vastgoed Luc Pacilly via luc.pacilly@prorail.nl

Uiterlijk 10 werkdagen na de sluitingsdatum hoor je van ons. De eerste gesprekken zullen plaatsvinden in de week van 12 april 2021, online via MS TEAMS.

Job Description & Summary

As a Manager within the Financial Services (“FS”) Valuations team, you will provide your clients with advice that enables them to make better decisions in a deal context. For example, performing valuations for clients that are buying or selling a business, helping companies in strategic decision-making, supporting the client in optimising the value potential of their business and post-deal services such as Purchase Price Allocations (PPA).

What does your work look like?

You will be mainly focussing on valuations of companies in the Financial Services (FS) industry. You value companies in pre deal situations, or other settings requiring important decision making, accounting purposes (such as PPA, impairment test) or in a legal or tax context, for example an internal reorganization. Furthermore you will work on business modelling and balance sheet management in general. Finally your financial services knowledge will be of use in many other disciplines within the dealcycle, such as: M&A strategy, due diligence, corporate finance and carve out or integration.

Our clients are the large insurance companies and banks in the FS sector combined with mid range clients and other FS industry clients like fintech, leasing and asset management clients.

In your role as a manager you will have daily contact with clients and you will have your own responsibilities within the larger project. You build relationships with clients and prospects and become more and more important in acquiring new business leads. You will also guide and coach more junior team members in their development.

To summarize, you and your team, will have the following core responsibilities:
With the purchase or sale of an enterprise or business unit: what is an enterprise worth, what are the synergy benefits, and what is a sensible price?;Drawing up and assessing of financial projections;Value creation analysis: why does an enterprise lag behind the competition and how can additional value be created?;Building M&A and valuation models for clients which they will use to make decisions and continue monitoring the performance of a business after a transaction;Modelling of the key value drivers of an insurance company or bank;Financial statement analysis (post-deal): performing Purchase Price Allocations after closing the transaction and providing support with the annual impairment testing procedures.

Who are you? 

You get energy from work that combines strategy and finance and in which your analytical skills are functional to practical solutions. You like working in several projects at the same time and you like to have a diverse agenda. You are a team player that likes to coach and develop others. Furthermore:.
You have a master degree in (Business) Economics, Business Administration, Econometrics, (Industrial) Engineering, Actuarial Studies or a technical study.programme. If you have a degree in another discipline and have an affinity with the field described above, we would also encourage you to apply for this position;You have at least 3 years of working experience within the FS sector, for example as a consultant in a Big 4, as a Manager Corporate Development in a M&A team or experience in balance sheet management at a bank or insurance company;You have knowledge of the required capital regime for European insurers, Solvency II / Basel;Valuations knowledge and experience with financial modelling;You have good English language skills. 

What do we offer?

The Valuations team is part of the Deals (M&A) division at PwC Advisory. The Deals division works on all deal related issues of our clients, from strategy to post-deal integration. As Manager FS Valuations you will be part of an integrated team of 25 colleagues that provide services to FS clients in all stages of their M&A business. In practice, this means that you will often be working on assignments with colleagues from other PwC divisions and colleagues from other countries.

Within the FS team there are currently 6 colleagues focussing on Valuations, including yourself the team consist of: 1 partner, 1 director, 1 manager, 1 senior analyst, 1 analyst often accompanied by other analysts of the broader Valuations team. We will devote much attention to your personal and technical development. The culture in the team is informal and we look after each other. We pay attention to development, coaching and wellbeing. Furthermore:
Extensive learning opportunities such as the Master in ValuationsPersonal Development and Leadership programsExcellent primary and secondary employment conditions, including company car, lease bike option, laptop, iPhone, 32 vacation days, and a personal wellbeing budget.Informal (online) get together activities like drinks, Christmas party, sportive events and more!

Apply now!

Are you interested, do you recognize yourself in our purpose and values and do you fit in with the profile? Please submit your application via the link.

Any questions? Please contact our Recruiter Liselotte Kloppenburg: liselotte.kloppenburg@pwc.com

After you submit your application we will be in touch within two weeks to report on your application’s progress.

Gemeenten en netbeheerders zijn steeds meer bezig met grondzaken, gebiedsontwikkeling en vastgoedprojecten. Maar om hun plannen écht van de grond te krijgen, moeten ze juridisch gezien onberispelijk zijn. Jij bent als jurist gespecialiseerd op dit gebied, dus hier draai jij je hand niet voor om. Ben jij onze nieuwe Jurist Grondzaken en Vastgoed? Solliciteer direct!

Over deze functie

Als Jurist Grondzaken en Vastgoed ben je het juridische fundament voor de plannen van een gemeente of netbeheerder. Zo ben je bijvoorbeeld verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen van overeenkomsten op het gebied van gebiedsontwikkelingen en vastgoedprojecten of gronduitgifte. Die overeenkomsten maak je ook voor zakelijke rechten, zoals erfpacht en recht van opstal. Daarnaast lever je een bijdrage aan het opstellen en uitvoeren van (gemeentelijk) grondbeleid.

Meestal is jouw werk een samenloop van publiekrecht en privaatrecht. Het is dus belangrijk dat je goed zicht hebt op wat er privaatrechtelijk mogelijk is en wat er publiekrechtelijk is toegestaan. Je houdt je bijvoorbeeld bezig met vragen als: hoe moet je omgaan met (semi-) openbaar gebied in een gebied van particulier eigendom? Mag een sportclub een nieuw clubhuis bouwen? Of kunnen bedrijven groenstroken ruilen met de gemeente? En hoe wordt omgegaan met staatssteun en aanbestedingsrecht?

Over jou

Natuurlijk is het belangrijk dat je een wo-diploma in de rechten hebt, het liefst in het privaatrecht of in het bestuursrecht. Daarnaast heb je bij voorkeur...
Minstens twee jaar werkervaring als jurist grondzaken en/of vastgoed Gevoel voor commerciële en bestuurlijke verhoudingen Ervaring met het opstellen, beoordelen en beheren van contracten op het gebied van grondexploitatie en gebiedsontwikkeling, erfpacht, uitgifte en verwerving van samenwerkingsverbanden Een oplossingsgerichte houding 

Wat wij bieden

Daarnaast Bieden We Nog

Wij zetten in op ontwikkeling, dus je kan rekenen op een flinke carrièrelift. Zo bieden we je bijvoorbeeld een breed scala aan verdiepende en verbredende opleidingen, inclusief de nodige certificaten. Welke bij jou past, ligt aan je ambities.
Een salaris op maat – dat is logisch Een bonusopportunity – successen moet je vieren Een vaste consultant – die alles voor je regelt en met je meedenkt over je loopbaan Een goede pensioenregeling – zodat het later ook goed met je gaat Korting op persoonlijke verzekeringen – mooi meegenomen Korting op sportieve en culturele uitjes – er is meer dan werk alleen 

Over ons
Zonder jurist blijven plannen bij plannen. Dat realiseren onze klanten zich heel goed. Gelukkig vinden ze in Brunel altijd een partij die er alles aan doet om hen te koppelen aan de beste juridische experts. En professionals kloppen op hun beurt bij ons aan om in contact te komen met de interessantste bedrijven. Die match, die maken we lang niet alleen in Nederland en zéker niet alleen in de Legal. Vanuit 35 landen over de hele wereld, zijn we namelijk ook actief in onder andere Finance & Risk en Engineering. Het kan dus zomaar voorkomen dat je op locatie andere Brunellers tegenkomt!

Dit ga je doen

Projectmatige werkzaamheden zijn jou niet onbekend! Zo breng jij de nodige werkervaring mee om de functie van assistent projectmanager tot een succes te maken! In deze baan werk je als een echte verbinder tussen meerdere stakeholders en weet je met gemak het overzicht te bewaren. Je kunt rekenen op een bruto-uurloon tot € 25,95, tegemoetkoming in je reiskostenvergoeding en bouw je pensioen op na 26 gewerkte weken. Wil jij in aanmerking komen voor deze baan? Lees dan gauw verder en vergeet niet te solliciteren!

Uitzendbureau Manpower zoekt een assistent projectmanager voor de gemeente Amsterdam.

Als assistent projectmanager speel je een inhoudelijke rol op de achtergrond bij de realisatie of aanpassingen van nieuwe maatschappelijke voorzieningen. Zo werk je mee aan de toekomst van ons mooie Mokum! Ook neem jij een deel van de nazorg omtrent deze projecten voor je rekening. Concreet betekent dit dat jij de volgende werkzaamheden uitvoert:

Werken aan voorzieningenprogramma’s voor transformatie- en stedelijke vernieuwingsgebieden, programma’s van eisen voor maatschappelijke voorzieningen en beheer- en exploitatieplannenBijdragen aan haalbaarheidsstudies en locatieonderzoekMeeschrijven aan beleidsnotities, collegebesluiten en stafvoordrachtenOverleggen met stakeholders

Dit krijg je

Brutosalaris tussen € 17,67 en € 25,95 per uurReiskostenvergoeding van € 0,06 per kilometerParttime of fulltime baan van 32 tot 36 uur per weekPensioenopbouw via Manpower na 26 gewerkte wekenUitzendcontract via ManpowerGratis toegang tot e-learningsplatform Studytube via Manpower

Hier ga je werken

Dit neem je mee

Minimaal een hbo-diploma of hoger in Planologie, Sociale Geografie of Bouw- en/of vastgoedmanagementTen minste drie jaar werkervaring met projectmanagement, bijvoorbeeld als assistent projectmanager, projectmanagement ondersteuner, project assistent of vergelijkbaarBeschikbaarheid van minimaal 32 uur per weekSterke organisatorische en analytische vaardigheden

Daarnaast herken jij jezelf in de volgende competenties: omgevingsbewustzijn, analytisch vermogen, resultaatgerichtheid, samenwerken, overtuigingskracht en relatiebeheer. Ook woon je bij voorkeur in (de buurt van) Amsterdam, Purmerend, Zaandam of Haarlem.

Ben je enthousiast geworden over deze vacature en wil je in aanmerking komen? Solliciteer vandaag nog en Manpower neemt binnen twee werkdagen contact met je op!

Over Manpower

Bijna niets in het leven is voor mensen zó essentieel als het vinden en behouden van zinvol werk. Wat dit betekent, is voor iedereen anders. Manpower biedt tijdelijke, flexibele en vaste banen. Onder meer binnen de financiële en zakelijke dienstverlening, overheid, klant contact centra, logistiek en productie. Het is onze passie om mensen verder te helpen. Dat doen we met een enorme gedrevenheid. We helpen je om succesvol te zijn bij een sollicitatie en dagen je uit om je te (blijven) ontwikkelen. Eerlijkheid vinden we belangrijk; we zijn transparant, staan open voor feedback en we doen wat we beloven.

At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.

From the morning essentials that get us started to the office space that inspires our productivity, the Office Administrator is there to make it happen. Your expertise lies in your positivity, approachability, and execution abilities in a rapidly changing startup environment ranging from top executives and real estate agents to engineers, new-hires, and interns. As Office Admin, you will be the first impression for the entire organization and play a critical role in the daily operations of the office.

At Compass You Will
 Serve as the face of Compass by welcoming guests and providing a high-touch experience. Follow appropriate processes to greet & register office guests, coordinate with the host, and issue temporary access & parking as needed. Maintain and order necessary office supplies from appropriate vendors Field general office inquiries via phone, in-person visitors, or email and provide first-response support to employees and customers (agents). Liaise with Fed-Ex, UPS, USPS, etc for all incoming and outgoing packages Process and distribute all incoming mail Ensure cleanliness and overall organization of all areas of the office, including reception, conference rooms, kitchen, and general common areas. Ensure facilities standards, security, and aesthetics are maintained by conducting daily quality-assurance walkthroughs, holding third party vendors accountable to their scope of services, and coordinating office repairs/services. Manage internal communications including office updates and newsletters Provide administrative support to member(s) of the Manager team as needed, including calendaring and scheduling management, travel arrangements, and time and expense reports Manage and execute the office’s standard operating procedures and tracking processes (including budgeting, SpaceIQ, Procurement, On-boarding, etc.). Provide Level 1 marketing and IT support to customers (agents) as needed. Log, update, and close Zendesk tickets as per standard operating procedures (where applicable).  Partner with various members of the Workplace Operations team and other parts of Compass on special projects and initiatives. Champion Compass culture by planning and executing in-office and off-site meetings and events. Process lease/referral paperwork, handle commission checks, and calculate agent commission breakdowns. Perform other related duties as requested or as responsibilities dictate 

What We Look For
 BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience 2-3 years of service experience with an emphasis on facilities, hospitality, corporate services, property management, or equivalent office management experience Articulate and polished communication style Friendly, warm personality Experience in providing administrative support in a professional work environment Experience with Google Suite is a plus Strong organizational skills, detail-oriented Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and master new software applications Proactive and resourceful Ability to multitask, establish priorities, meet deadlines, and make sound decisions in a fast-paced environment. Experience at a startup or real estate brokerage preferred 

Do your best work, be your authentic self

At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

We believe that it is the task of each generation to leave its children a healthier planet. To succeed in this we create responsible choices, everyday – choices that enable people to live a more sustainable life and consume fewer natural resources.

There are roughly 5500 Neste Employees in Europe, Asia and North America. We are the world’s largest producer of renewable diesel refined from waste and residues, and we are also bringing renewable solutions to the aviation and plastics industries. We are looking for the best professionals in their respective fields – people who have the will to make the world a cleaner place to live.

Are you up for the challenge? Be part of one of our talented teams and join us on our journey to a carbon-neutral world.

The Land Logistics Transportation Specialist Europe is responsible for managing and developing Neste’s land logistics, unitized logistics (trains, trucks and potentially containers), in European markets. 

The Land Logistics Transportation Specialist Europe develops, sources and implements transport solutions matching business requirements and enabling continuous development and growth. 

This specialist will need to build on his/her existing relationship in the market of logistics service. Providers, especially trucking, rail transport and deep sea container shipping companies as well as 3 / 4 PL’s. This role must ensure seamless integration of business units with land logistics capabilities and offerings. Responsibilities include successful negotiations with service providers related to land logistics and ensuring efficient logistics supplier management through efficient follow-up procedures and leading corrective and preventive actions as appropriate. The Land Logistics Transportation Specialist will play a key role in developing Neste’s growing demand for unitized (trains, containers, trucks) transport along with bringing in-depth knowledge and experience of land logistics transport markets in the Area.

Key Responsibilities

 Work as part of the Land Logistics unit to significantly develop and manage Neste’s unitized (trains, trucks and containers) land logistics in Europe

 Source, contract and develop relationships with rail transport operators, trucking companies and deep sea operators

Support and manage (hands-on) ad-hoc transportation requests from various Business Units

 Develop performance management of above mentioned logistics service suppliers

 Develop accurate market information of the land logistics and practices in the Area to provide insight to (Senior) Management and other stakeholders

 Liaise and collaborate with multiple internal business units locally and globally

 Keep up-to-date knowledge of Industry Standards/General Terms and Conditions for relevant products

Requirements

 Relevant university degree with 5 - 10 years of working experience in relevant industry

 Relevant experience in liquid unitized transports for this industry

 Experience in managing logistics service providers

 Proven track record of success in this field and deep understanding of logistics processes required in this environment

 Good understanding of future trends in land logistics and analytical thinking

 Strong interpersonal skills and ability and willingness to work in intercultural environment

 Strong stress tolerance and confidence needed to define and, if needed, defend ideas

 Fluent written and spoken English, other languages (preferably Dutch) are considered as an advantage

 Hands-on attitude able to utilize their knowledge, experience and network to build a successful logistics model for this developing business

The Office is located in the Amsterdam area.

A security clearance is obtained for the persons with their consent.

Imagine yourself working in an international team, providing innovative, top-notch legal advice to clients who are the leaders of today and tomorrow in their sector and working seamlessly together across teams and offices. This is Clifford Chance. As a single, fully integrated global partnership, we pride ourselves on our approachable, collaborative and innovative way of working.

Our Amsterdam office has been providing clients with the high-quality advice and legal insight for almost half a century. We combine the Firm's global standards with our in-depth expertise and network in the Dutch market and abroad. We always strive to exceed the expectations of our clients, which include major financial institutions, financial investors (which includes private equity and infrastructure investors), corporates from all sectors (including major tech companies), governments, regulators, trade bodies and non-profit organisations.

On a daily basis we focus on innovative ways of working to best support our clients and their businesses. In 2020 we have been awarded the prestigious Gouden Zandloper Innovation Award.
Quality of service and professionalism are highly valued, as are pro-active attitude and teamwork. We value work ethic, respect and good communication to get the best results for our clients and to ensure we create a welcoming and safe work environment for all our colleagues.

Who You Will Work With

The practice group Energy, Infrastructure & Real Estate is recognized by all leading legal directories as a top tier practice with top tier clients. The group has an impressive track record for its transactional advice in renewable energy (offshore wind, onshore wind, solar, nuclear, district heating) and related "smart energy" solutions, infrastructure and/or real estate or project finance.
Our basis is in Amsterdam, but our practice and our client base has a strong international character. The offering to our clients is a fully integrated product including commercial contracting, financing documentation, corporate and fund structuring and regulatory advice.

Our team, compromised of 1 Partner, 4 associates and 3 trainee lawyers has been advising key players of the sector, whether local or international, and has gained a strong reputation over the years as a result of its successful involvements in major Project Finance and Real Estate transactions.
We have a global outlook, coupled with experience of a variety of work in multiple jurisdictions, producing the quality of expertise required for major cross border work.

What You Will Be Responsible For

In the context of the continuous development of our activities, we are currently looking for a talented lawyer with experience and interest in one or more of the following fields:
  Commercial contracting, including construction contracts, power purchase agreements, service level agreements, sale and purchache agreements and/or;   Regulatory expertise, e.g. energy regulatory, environmental law, planning and zoning law, procurement law;  
in the fields of Energy, Infrastructure and/or Real Estate.

As an associate in our Projects / Real Estate team, you will be working on some of the world's largest and most complex transactions. Our lawyers provide a seamless integrated service across our network of offices and across different areas of expertise including project finance transactions, project M&A, real estate transactions. real estate finance and advisory work.
  You will provide legal and commercial expertise predominantly on project finance and real estate transactions as well as advisory work, across a wide raAnge of sectors including renewable energy, industrial sites, real estate (residential, hotel, logistics, office space, healthcare assets, industrials and data centres.   You will be developing relationships with clients and actively engaging in business development and thought leadership initiatives and seeking out opportunities for new work as you grow not only your legal but also entrepreneurial skill set.   You will be drafting complex legal documents clearly and concisely, creating solutions using legal knowledge and commercial judgement to advise and support leading multi-national clients.  

Qualifications

 Your career experience so far 

You will have a solid background in Projects/Real Estate law or general law with the ambition to work on a variety of transactions, probably gained at a firm with a highly regarded profile. We are looking for associates who are able to think outside the box to create bespoke solutions to meet our clients' business objectives.

In Short You Bring
  3 to 6 years of relevant experience in one or more of the areas of expertise mentioned above;   Enthusiastic about keeping up with the latest trends and decisions in project/real estate;   Intellectual curiosity and creative thinking;   Ability to see the bigger picture;   Good communication and negotiation skills;   Team player;   Proactive, resourceful, takes initiative;   Fluency in English.  
It is crucial that you can demonstrate an appetite for business development, client relationship management and thought leadership.

A Dutch law qualification is required.

How We Will Support You

From your first day with us, you will have varied opportunities to continuously grow and develop your skills and knowledge. You will work in a dynamic, multicultural environment and in a fun team of energetic professionals. You'll get the opportunity to develop your legal and business skills by following tailored (international) trainings and courses with our Clifford Chance Academy.
  You will be working for a firm and team with more tier one rankings than any other law firm.   You will be working with a broad range of clients and the firm's other teams and practice areas, not only in Amsterdam, but across the globe.   You will have exposure to work which often involves complex matters that frequently headline in the financial and business press, and also work involving emerging markets and technologies.   You will have extensive client contact both as part of your daily working routine but will also have the opportunity to develop client contacts through a wide range of opportunities including organising seminars for our key clients, or providing bespoke client training.   You will develop an unbeatable multi-disciplinary skill set as well as client facing skills whilst working with some of the best-known market leaders in their respective practice areas.   We will provide the opportunity for you to develop as a recognised practitioner in the field.   The role comes with a competitive salary & benefits package and attractive working conditions.  

 To find out more 
Interested? Please contact Nina Rolsma, Recruitment Manager, via nina.rolsma@cliffordchance.com ..

We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurial Head of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) who is ready to shine in a new, international team. Mileway is on a strong growth path and by joining as they move into their second year of business, you can be there on the ground to set an ambitious sustainability agenda.
 
Mileway are the European leader in last-mile logistics, a sector supporting the fast growing e-commerce sector. Mileway's 9,000 customers are blue chip retailers, logistics service providers manufacturers, smaller and globally operating e-commerce ventures and local businesses. You will be the driving force on ESG with both Mileway's varied customer base and the thriving metropolitan communities they operate in. Mileway's rapidly growing portfolio of last-mile logistics assets has performed exceptionally last year, and the company now has over 1,400 properties worth over €14 billion.
 
Mileway launched in September 2019, which puts you among the first people to work on Mileway's ESG program and gives enormous scope to shape the way responsible business is done.
 
 
What you will do
Own Mileway's sustainability strategy, policy and execution, collaborating with stakeholders from the C-suite to local market teams to communicate and carry out your visionFurther develop and implement the Mileway ESG Framework and put together and manage a dedicated ESG teamDevelop an ESG reporting strategy, first internally and later externally, following best practices on sustainability reportingCreate a roadmap to define Mileway's current sustainability features within the portfolioSupporting external communication to investors and stakeholders on material developments in the fund's ESG performance and credentialsEstablish an ESG Committee to ensure bottom-up adoption of ESG best practices across the organization 
Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, you will be responsible for driving Mileway's sustainability strategy. With the support of the Executive team and the recently appointed Senior ESG Manager, you will further define baselines, ambitions and set targets for the short and midterm and manage reporting. You will work directly with a diverse range of stakeholders including senior leadership, core investor Blackstone and regional teams across the globe.
 
What you will bring 
Your excellent industry credentials. You have extensive demonstrable experience working with corporate C-suite and investors to build consensus on leading-edge sustainability initiatives. You are experienced in business and operational transformationsAdaptability and an instinct for what works. You will be building a program within the context of a fast-growing and evolving international business that you'll grow alongsideYour team attitude. You bring energy and desire to lead, inspire, drive processes, and positively influence those around youYour collaborative approach. You know how to work with and get buy in from diverse stakeholders, and ideally, you will already have done so in an international companyExcellent communication skills. You can communicate up and down the organization and with external stakeholders. Your English is fluent, and an additional language is an advantageReal estate experience is a plus, or experience in a related field like construction or logistics 
This is a challenging role, suitable for a seasoned professional with the knowledge, vision and team attitude to put their stamp on a brand-new, international market-leader. If you're working in an organisation far along its journey to embedding sustainability in its main business strategy and you're ready to try something new, please apply below.

About The Role

As Miro's head of brand, you will help Miro tell our story to the world and better fulfill our mission to empower millions of teams everywhere to create the next big thing.

As the Head of Brand, you will report directly to the CMO and be a key part of Miro's marketing leadership team. You will bring deep experience in brand strategy, advertising, and brand measurement and a passion for storytelling and distinctive identity.

The Head of Brand will help to standardize our brand identity, vision, promise, creative, voice, and storytelling, while driving growth through advertising, communications, and activation. The ideal candidate will have a deep working knowledge of brand strategy, advertising theory, and brand investment measurement. You should have experience producing award-winning creative advertising that drives strong business results. You will be an outstanding leader with experience building and leading high performance teams.

What You'll Do
 Be Miro's brand champion Build a team that is creative, skilled in storytelling, and fluent in the math and theory of advertising Translate user insights, market analysis, and top-level business priorities into a clear brand strategy Establish a research foundation for brand-building including definition of category entry points and development of brand tracking and measurement Develop and manage distinctive brand assets including company identity, category definition, company positioning, and campaign assets Develop a strategy to drive long-term business growth through advertising and lead the process to develop, test, and measure creative campaigns with a focus on experimentation Put in place an effective model for media buying and media optimization Use econometric modelling, long-term experiments, and other techniques to measure brand campaign performance Manage the business case for brand investment and track and report on progress against long-term objectives. Manage our internal brand studio teams which serves all of Miro Lead and mentor high performing team that infuses Miro's brand across all marketing activities 

What You'll Need
 10+ years of demonstrated success building great brands (including 5+ years client-side)  A body of work that includes at least one famous or award-winning campaign for a great brand A deep understanding of advertising theory including Byron Sharp, Peter Field, Les Binet, Robert Heath, and others Experience managing marketing budgets > $25 million A disposition toward using market & customer data, research, and experimentation to drive outstanding results. Experience building and leading high-performing, high-creativity teams Sound business judgement; strategic and data analytical capabilities  

What's In It For You
 Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Travel allowance for your commute Lunch, snacks and drinks provided Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly team activities (even virtually) to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global team Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam 

About Miro

Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 10 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes.

At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!

Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!
